summary: Problem when overriding Dialog.createDialogArea (1GCQBAP)
description: Problem when overriding Dialog.createDialogArea (1GCQBAP) [reply] Description Andre Weinand 2001-10-10 22:22:37 EDT If Dialog.createDialogArea(Composite parent) is overridden and a FComposite is returned nothing will be visible unless the correct layout data has been set on the Composite.  This is problematic since it couples a client's implementation of createDialogArea to an implementation detail of the base class (and it shows thatControl.setLayoutData is not a good idea in the first place).  If this  behavior cannot be fixed it should be documented in the method's JavaDoc!  NOTES:  [reply] Comment 1 DJ Houghton 2001-10-24 06:50:35 EDT PRODUCT VERSION: SDK 0.047    [reply] Comment 2 Kevin Haaland 2002-01-21 21:43:37 EST My preference would be to update the javadoc.  [reply] Comment 3 Ian Petersen 2002-01-28 16:36:44 EST The javadoc has been changed to reflect the dependency in both createDialogArea and createButtonBar.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: [JFace] DialogSettings convenience methods do not check for null
description: [JFace] DialogSettings convenience methods do not check for null [reply] Description Nick Edgar 2001-10-22 12:27:28 EDT In DialogSettings, convenience methods like getBoolean() do not check for null. They just call getString(String) then try to convert. This method can return null, though.  [reply] Comment 1 Nick Edgar 2001-10-22 12:46:47 EDT The current implementation seems to work, since new Boolean(null) and new Integer(null) yield the behaviour spec'ed for the DialogSettings convenience methods.  Need to check that this is spec'ed behaviour for how Boolean(String) and Integer(String) handle null.  [reply] Comment 2 Nick Edgar 2002-01-27 21:57:16 EST Please check to ensure we're conforming to spec. Explicit null checks would be better.  [reply] Comment 3 Ian Petersen 2002-01-31 12:03:40 EST I added the explicit null checks and now getDouble, getFloat, getInt and getLong all throw NumberFormatExceptions if the key that is passed in does not correlate to a setting. summary: TVT: Reset Defaults button on resources Properties is misleading
description: TVT: Reset Defaults button on resources Properties is misleading [reply] Description Dan Kehn 2001-11-08 11:48:03 EST From our TVT testers, a very minor nit:  If you open a doc, the default setting is with the "Read only" option unselected. If you set it, and click on Apply, if you then click on Reset Defaults, it doesn't reset the check-box as unselected.  This may be a "generic" button, but in this context, the button should either be removed or changed to "Reset" (which is defined as resetting those settings to their value before the panel was entered, not the same as Undo).  The button "Reset Defaults" doesn't make a lot of sense in this context.  I suppose you could define the default read-only state as "off", then selecting the button would systematically reset the read-only bit...  [reply] Comment 1 Ian Petersen 2002-02-12 10:36:40 EST Windows and Linux both set a new file's read-only bit to 'off', so this feels like a default.  The reset defaults button now sets the read-only bit to off to match this feeling.  [reply] Comment 2 Richard Bone 2002-05-07 14:46:55 EDT Verified as fixed in build 425 of R2 with NL fragments  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: More tolarant when not finding product.ini
description: More tolarant when not finding product.ini [reply] Description Martin Aeschlimann 2001-11-28 10:51:02 EST The most common problem when starting a selfhosted eclipse is that the product.ini is not found. - Either org.eclipse.sdk is missing, or - the install directory (eclipse/install) is not there.  Would it be possible, if eclipse can start up even when product.ini is not found? I would not mind having a default icon or default splash screen etc.  [reply] Comment 1 Ian Petersen 2002-01-28 15:23:19 EST I changed ProductInfo.java, PlatformInfo.java, and ConfigurationInfo.java to allow Eclipse to boot with missing or malformed product.ini, platform.ini, product.properties, or platform.properties.  Instead of throwing a CoreException, these prblems just get written to the log and Eclipse continues booting.  The worst case scenario now is that the workbench looks really ugly. summary: Dialog should have getButton(int id)
description: Dialog should have getButton(int id) [reply] Description Nick Edgar 2002-01-14 10:35:28 EST Build 20020109 In EC post "jface.Dialog: Change the default state of a button", "Robert Stephan" writes: > I am wondering, wether it is possible to change the default state of a "OK" > or "Cancel" button in a jface Dialog. > > Under certain circumstances (wrong user inputs) I would like to temporarly > disable the "OK" button and set the "Cancel" button as Default. > > The first part I realized by overwriting createButtonsForButtonBar > > protected void createButtonsForButtonBar(Composite parent) > { > btnOK = createButton(parent, IDialogConstants.OK_ID, > IDialogConstants.OK_LABEL, true); > btnCancel =createButton(parent, IDialogConstants.CANCEL_ID, > IDialogConstants.CANCEL_LABEL, false); > } > > By doing so I can set the defaultState in the beginning and get a reference > for each button to disable them later. > > Now I am looking for a way to change the default state, because it makes no > sence to have a disabled button as default. The problem seems to be, that > the setDefault() method of a Button is not visible. I've replied that he can use getShell().setDefaultButton(Button). However, he should not have to copy the code in createButtonsForButtonBar just to be able to retrieve them later. We should consider adding a method to Dialog: /** * Returns the button with the given id. * * @param id (** copy the spec from createButton **) * @return the button with the given id, or null if not found */ Button getButton(int id); [reply] Comment 1 Ian Petersen 2002-01-29 11:32:10 EST We decided to add getOKButton() and getCancelButton() methods instead of getButton(int id). Now, the default implementation of Dialog.createButton stores buttons that are created with ids equal to IDialogConstants.OK_ID and IDialogConstants.CANCEL_ID in private fields and exposes them via the new methods. Add Comment Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Properties page unresponsive after reopening
description: Properties page unresponsive after reopening [reply] Description Paul Church 2002-01-14 13:34:23 EST Build: 20020109  After making the Properties view a fast view and then closing it, the view does not respond to mouse clicks when reopened. View remains unresponsive until Eclipse is restarted. Tested in both Java and Resource perspectives.  1. Launch a fresh Eclipse session. 2. Open a Properties view through Perspective->Show View->Properties, restore the view if it appears as a fast view. 3. Drag the view to the shortcut bar to make it a fast view. 4. Click the icon in the shortcut bar to pop up the properties view. 5. Close the view. 6. Re-open the Properties view through Perspective->Show View->Properties 7. The view appears as a regular view, but does not respond to mouse movement or clicks. All other views work normally. If Eclipse is closed and restarted the Properties view shows up in the same location and now works normally.  [reply] Comment 1 Nick Edgar 2002-01-15 14:54:50 EST I was unable to reproduce this on 20020109 plus the latest UI changes (20020115). Randy, was there a recent change here which would have fixed this? If not, please mark the PR as invalid.  [reply] Comment 2 Nick Edgar 2002-01-15 14:57:56 EST I was in the Resource perspective. Paul, when you say it was unresponsive, what exactly do you mean? That you couldn't drag the view, or that properties weren't properly shown and navigated? Since the workspace is empty, there are no properties shown.  But when I create a project, they work fine.  [reply] Comment 3 Nick Edgar 2002-01-15 15:09:04 EST See also bug 7536. Not clear that this is a duplicate though.  [reply] Comment 4 Paul Church 2002-01-15 15:28:52 EST The view was drawn correctly (including the correct contents for whatever was selected) but the buttons didn't 'highlight' on mouseover, buttons didn't 'press' (visually) when clicked, contents didn't highlight when clicked (keyboard navigation also wasn't possible), and no events happened when buttons were clicked. Trying to drag by the title bar produced no change in the view's appearance.  The contents of the 'frozen' properties view acutally do update when the active selection changes, and closing the perspective makes the view go away. It just appears that the view doesn't react to any mouse or keyboard events.  [reply] Comment 5 Simon Arsenault 2002-01-15 15:59:13 EST I've seem this problem happen also with the 20020109 build. If you look at the view when it is not responsive, it has all the fast view icons on it. It seems to think it is a fast view still. Come see me if you want to see how to reproduce it.  [reply] Comment 6 Ian Petersen 2002-01-28 16:09:59 EST This problem was in the Perspective class.  Clicking on the X to close a view eventually makes a call to Perspective.hideView(IViewPart) which, if the IViewPart is a fast view, calls Perspective.hideFastView(IViewPart). hideFastView is also called when you minimize a fast view so the view's control is disabled to prevent the focus from ending up on an invisible widget.  The problem was that showing the view again didn't necessesarily re-enable the control, so the view remained unresponsive.  I changed Perspective.hideView(IViewPart) to re-enable the IViewPart's control after the call to hideFastView returns.  While fixing this bug, I also discovered that a view might end up in an inconsistent state where it has the toolbar buttons of a fast view, but isn't one, or where it is a fast view, but doesn't have the pin or minimize buttons.  The fix was to change ViewPane.SystemContribution.fill(ToolBar, int).  This method gets called every time the view's toolbar manager needs to be updated, and it is responsible for deciding whether or not to include the pin and minimize buttons.  To make this decision, it was calling ViewPane.isFastView which then calls Perspective.isFastView. This return value may not reflect current pane state. Now, the decision is based on the internal instance variable fast.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Dialog page resizing
description: Dialog page resizing [reply] Description Alex Nan 2002-01-25 19:28:22 EST I encountered the following problem which I think might be common to other people: I have a wizard page (dialog page) that displays fine in english but for NL platforms (ex. German, French, Italian) the description of the page doesn't fit anymore, it allows only 2 lines of  text, so the page has to be resized somehow according to the length of the description. I write you the strings used in the description, maybe they might guide you somehow: "No database or schema selected. Select a database or schema and try again.", "Es wurde keine Datenbank bzw. kein Schema ausgew?hlt. W?hlen Sie eine Datenbank oder ein Schema aus, und wiederholen Sie die Anforderung.", "Aucune sch?ma ou base de donn?es s?lectionn?. S?lectionnez une base de donn?es ou un sch?ma et tentez ´ nouveau l'op?ration.", sorry for the special chars that are corrupted... This is the code we are using to generate the content of the client area:  public void createControl(Composite parent) {  // top level group Composite composite = new Composite(parent,SWT.NONE); composite.setLayout(new GridLayout()); composite.setLayoutData(new GridData( GridData.VERTICAL_ALIGN_FILL | GridData.HORIZONTAL_ALIGN_FILL));  fbg = new FolderBrowseGroup(composite, this, ""); fbg.getFolderNameField().addListener(SWT.Modify, this);  createDatabaseSchemaGroup(composite);  setPageComplete(determinePageCompletion()); setControl(composite); // should be on top level composite/group }  private void createDatabaseSchemaGroup(Composite parent) { Composite dbSchGroup = new Composite(parent,SWT.NONE); GridLayout layout = new GridLayout(); layout.numColumns = 3; dbSchGroup.setLayout(layout); dbSchGroup.setLayoutData(new GridData(GridData.FILL_HORIZONTAL));  // database/schema selection new Label(dbSchGroup,SWT.NONE).setText("Target")); targetField = new Text(dbSchGroup, SWT.BORDER); GridData data = new GridData(GridData.FILL_HORIZONTAL); targetField.setLayoutData(data); targetField.setEditable(false);  targetBrowseButton = new Button(dbSchGroup, SWT.PUSH); targetBrowseButton.setText(RSCPlugin.getString("Browse...")); targetBrowseButton.addListener(SWT.Selection, this);  }  Actually the problem can be reproduced in a very simple scenario, create a wizard page that has, let's say, only a text box in the client area and set the description to a string sufficiently long. The wizard will resize according to the text boxes layout but it won't take into account the size of the description string, if this is long enough it will need more than 2 lines which are allocated for it. The user of the WizardPage class can control only the size of the client area, but he cannot figure out how much space the description will take because he doesn't have access to the font that is used to display the description etc. so it's really a matter of guessing. Thank you.  Alexandru Nan  [reply] Comment 1 Ian Petersen 2002-02-25 12:26:35 EST Rather than link the dialog's size to the length of its label, I've changed the setMessage and setErrorMessage methods on TitleAreaDialog to set the tooltip text equal to the text for the label.  This should allow the user to see the full text of the message by hovering over the label with the mouse, even if the label itself clips the text.  This change didn't make it into the latest stable build (20020214) but it should be in the next integration build.  [reply] Comment 2 Alex Nan 2004-11-09 19:07:46 EST Closing.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Import declaration scopes
description: Import declaration scopes [reply] Description Vijay Aravamudhan 2002-09-27 10:09:11 EDT hi, JDK 1.4 has "fixed" a bug which can be found at: http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/bugs/4361575.html  But this breaks Eclipse: I am a developer on an open source project called jfcunit where we have the JDK Swing demo jar file. I changed the sources to put all the sources in a package called 'demo' instead of the default package. Then I put the jar file in my project area and refreshed it in Eclipse. Once I did this, I (obviously) had to change the actual source files that refer to any classes from the jar to include the package declaration. After doing this, I thought that everything should be fine and dandy - but, there still appears a "problem indication" marker wherever the new pcakge or its classes are used. The marker is not the fully filled red rectangle, but the white rectangle with the red border. If I turn on the "show problems before compilation" in the preferences, these same lines are also underlined with red wavy lines. Is this a bug in Eclipse?  [reply] Comment 1 Philipe Mulet 2002-09-30 06:12:43 EDT The URL you mentionned in your description doesn't seem to work at the moment. Can you please describe a little more the nature of your problem ?   [reply] Comment 2 Vijay Aravamudhan 2002-09-30 17:00:47 EDT Well, according to the bug report, Sun has "fixed" the specs and the javac compiler to error out when any class files are not in a namespace (package). In other words, if anyone tries to compile their demo sources (which are not in any package), the compile would error out.  So I had to change some files to be in some dummy package - and when this was done, no errors/warnings showed up in the "Tasks" area - but there were still white boxes with red borders which showed up in the right margin area (which is used to normally indicate that there are compile warnings/errors).  [reply] Comment 3 Philipe Mulet 2002-10-02 06:45:32 EDT Got it. Now this change in javac is only part of JDK1.4. In a consistent manner, you will notice that when toggling our compiler in 1.4 mode, you'll get the same behavior (see Window>Preferences>Java>Compiler>JDK Compliance>Compiler Compliance Level>1.4).  [reply] Comment 4 Vijay Aravamudhan 2002-10-02 08:48:19 EDT Thanks - that did it!  [reply] Comment 5 Vijay Aravamudhan 2008-01-09 17:22:15 EST Closing  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Text merge failures
description: Text merge failures [reply] Description Jonathan Gossage 2002-10-19 07:37:39 EDT I have discovered a problem with text merging. I have built a Junit test case that is driven off a structured text file that shows two failures. One of the failures is extracted from test1 of the current test scripts. I am attaching the files that implement the test case and the test data file.  I ran the test case from the Eclipse launcher as a Junit test and set the working directory to the directory that contained the test data file.  [reply] Comment 1 Jonathan Gossage 2002-10-19 07:39:07 EDT Created attachment 2236 [details] The Junit test case  [reply] Comment 2 Jonathan Gossage 2002-10-19 07:39:37 EDT Created attachment 2237 [details] The test fixture for the Junit test  [reply] Comment 3 Jonathan Gossage 2002-10-19 07:40:29 EDT Created attachment 2238 [details] Encapsulates an individual test  [reply] Comment 4 Jonathan Gossage 2002-10-19 07:41:06 EDT Created attachment 2239 [details] Encapsulates problems with text merge test data  [reply] Comment 5 Jonathan Gossage 2002-10-19 07:41:57 EDT Created attachment 2240 [details] The test data file for text merge tests  [reply] Comment 6 Mark C. Chu-Carroll 2002-10-22 13:28:10 EDT Error reproduces on linux. Tests one and three fail.  [reply] Comment 7 Mark C. Chu-Carroll 2002-10-22 13:37:05 EDT Test three looks to be formulated incorrectly. In it, base and target are identical. The generated merge result is correct according to our algorithm.  The text around the test indicates that it's intended to be the same as file1 in script test 1. But in script test 1, base and target are *different*.  I tried adding the following as a new test, which is the same as file1 in script test 1, and it worked correctly. :test3a # The same as the first test script in org.stellation.misc\tests\test1\file1 # Base sequence   Delta Sequence   Target Sequence   Expected Sequence abc             abc              abc               abc def		  def              bingo             bingo ghi             123456           def               def jkl             ghi              ghi               123456 mno             jkl              jkl               ghi pqr             mno              mno               jkl stu             pqr              pqr               mno vwx             vwx              stu               pqr yz		  yz               vwx               vwx "  "		  "  "             yz                yz ""		  ''		   "  "		      "  "   [reply] Comment 8 Mark C. Chu-Carroll 2002-10-22 13:40:08 EDT Test one is definitely a legit merge bug. I'm checking the code to see if it's a flaw in the merge algebra, or just an implementation glitch.  [reply] Comment 9 Jonathan Gossage 2002-10-22 17:07:33 EDT I was afraid that might be the case for test 3 since I had a lot of trouble with the test data and CVS. I am glad to here that there is only one problem.  [reply] Comment 10 Mark C. Chu-Carroll 2002-10-25 20:26:14 EDT The glitch was an off-by-one error causing errors when there was a trailing addition in delta or target that was one line long.  I'd like to get someone to add more test cases to make sure that all of the one-line cases are correct - I want to make sure that there are no more off-by-ones like this. (Jonathan, I'm tentatively transferring this to you. If you don't want to do work out some more test cases, just transfer it back to me.)  The change won't get checked in for a day or two, until I'm sure that the ACL changes in my workspace won't break anything. summary: Log manager utility module
description: Log manager utility module [reply] Description Jonathan Gossage 2002-10-26 13:00:31 EDT I have created a new class,org.eclipse.stellation.util.LogManager to manage the Log4j environment. It is based on the method org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Svc.debug() but added the additional functionality to look for a system property named "StellationLogLevel" which can contain the logging level. As at present it defaults to no logging.  The motivation for this class was a need to add logging in Junit tests but it is generally useful and provides a flexible base if we ever need more sophisticated logging capabilities. summary: [ssh2] provide key generation tools
description: [ssh2] provide key generation tools [reply] Description Tom Roche 2003-10-28 21:16:36 EST The cvsssh2 plugin solves most of the problem of interacting with CVS via ssh2: notably it removes the need for the user to install and configure an external ssh2 and ssh-agent. But even with that the user must generate and install keypairs, which  * is non-trivial. E.g. start @  http://sourceforge.net/docman/display_doc.php?docid=761&group_id=1#keygen  and skip the SF-specific content.  * requires external tools (i.e. Cygwin ssh-keygen)  Thus cvsssh2 represents only a partial solution to the ssh2 problem. I would like to see a more complete one, wherein one or more Eclipse plugins assists the user with  1 keypair generation. Note that JSch (the cvsssh2 folks) may already have work in this direction:  http://www.jcraft.com/jsch/index.html > TODO  > * generating RSA, DSA key pairs.  2 keypair installation. Given the keypairs, local install (creating something that works like a ~/.ssh) is pretty trivial: save to local dir, and point to it. (See Windows>Preferences>Team>CVS>CVSSSH2.) Remote install is trickier, but Jsch appears to already support scp and sftp, and you already have org.eclipse.team.ftp, so again existing work could be leveraged.  With this functionality, Eclipse would ease another barrier to entry to participation in OSS and IIOSB projects. I also realize you already have things to do, but it also seems that, in this case, existing pieces need only to be "glued together."  TIA, Tom Roche, Rational Studio Model2 Tooling, abbotforswt admin  [reply] Comment 1 Atsuhiko Yamanaka 2003-12-03 11:17:19 EST Hi, I'm the author of that stuff.  FYI, jsch has supported DSA keypair generation and RSA keypair generation will be also supported soon. So, it is time to glue together!  [reply] Comment 2 Atsuhiko Yamanaka 2003-12-11 13:27:22 EST FYI, the plugin, org.eclipse.team.cvs.ssh2, hosted in the Eclipse's CVS repository, has supported DSA and RSA key pair generation.  [reply] Comment 3 Atsuhiko Yamanaka 2004-01-10 00:07:14 EST Eclipse 3.0 M6 has provided key generation tools.  [reply] Comment 4 Jean-Michel Lemieux 2004-02-09 10:12:34 EST to verify  [reply] Comment 5 Michael Valenta 2004-02-11 11:57:39 EST I have verified that the key generation tools work. See bug 45705 for suggested enhancement and bug 51664 for a bug in failed connection handing.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Drop control in null layout -should set to preferred size
description: Drop control in null layout -should set to preferred size [reply] Description Joe Winchester 2004-04-20 06:40:18 EDT Drop a control without dragging a size and it can't be seen (the size is 0,0) What VE Swing does is set the size to be -1,-1 (or Integer.MIN_VALUE ?) in the edit policy, and the proxy adapter picks these up and then gets the current preferred size from the target VM (which can only be computed after it has been added to the parent) and sets them so the user sees a good initial size. summary: Optimized Heap Dump directory specification in piAgent
description: Optimized Heap Dump directory specification in piAgent [reply] Description Allan Pratt 2004-04-21 19:10:11 EDT This bug reflects decisions by me, Anandi, and Richard. It is targeted at Piyush.  We decided:  1. There should be just one way to set the directory name that opt heap dumps will be written into.  2. That way should be in a <variable> element in ServiceConfig.xml, not an <option> in the agent's pluginconfig.xml. This way it's visible to all agents, not just the piAgent.  3. The variable name should not be TEMP, it should be LOCAL_AGENT_TEMP_DIR.  4. The default value for LOCAL_AGENT_TEMP_DIR, written into serviceconfig.xml by SetConfig, should be %TMP%  Here are the OptHeapDump-related action items that come out of those agreements:  * Please change the Leakbot code in the agent so it uses ra_getEnvironmentVariable("LOCAL_AGENT_TEMP_DIR") (and not an option query for OPTHEAP_TEMP_DIR) to find out where to write optheap dump files.  * If LOCAL_AGENT_TEMP_DIR is not set, please use ra_getEnvironmentVariable ("TMP") as a backup. It should always be set, on all platforms. But if it's not set, give it whatever fallback behavior it has now, write to the current directory or something.  [reply] Comment 1 Piyush Agarwal 2004-04-29 04:45:17 EDT That way should be in a <variable> element in ServiceConfig.xml, not an <option> in the agent's pluginconfig.xml. summary: AS400 - RAC File Copy is not working
description: AS400 - RAC File Copy is not working [reply] Description Anandi Krishnamurthy 2004-05-27 16:02:14 EDT Here is how I found out that this does not work. I logged into toras3rm. The rac version in /home/racbuild/head/trybuid has a couple of fixes needed to get to the stage where the RAC File Copy bug is exposed. Please use that if you can.  I brought up the workbench, connected to the RAC on toras3rm, and did Manual Leak Analysis on simpleleaker (which is in /home/testcup on that machine).  Once the application comes up, take 2 heapdump by clicking on the camera icon that shows up, DETACH from the test program, terminate the test program.  Now, bring up the context menu on the profiling entry for the run and select "Analyze for Leaks". The first step that this does is to copy the files from the AS400 to your local workspace using RAC File Copy. This fails.  [reply] Comment 1 Anandi Krishnamurthy 2004-05-27 16:19:14 EDT You need the 2 leak analysis plugins to reproduce this bug. Please go to http://pplus-web-1.cupertino.ibm.com/bluerat_build/ and download the latest versions of the following 2 plugins:  com.ibm.rational.pd.leak.analysis com.ibm.rational.pd.leak.ui  [reply] Comment 2 Robert Danek 2004-06-04 18:51:11 EDT I'm not familiar with the File Copy code in the RAC, so my comments are based on best guesses as to how this stuff is supposed to work.  If you look at the servicelog.log when RAServer starts you will see  <SERVER_MSG time="2004:6:4:18:10:1" severity="SEVERE" text="Could not get ID for method file server constructor" file="./framework/RAServer/RACommS.c" line="801"/>  That is, the file server isn't being started.  The problem is that when you make JNI calls, the strings you pass to JNI have to be in UTF-8. To do this, you can use  #ifdef __OS400__ #pragma convert(819) #endif  <code where string literals should be in ASCII>  #ifdef __OS400__ #pragma convert(0) #endif  I made some changes to RACommS.c to do this where appropriate in the createFileServer() method. You can see these changes in /home/racbuild/head/trybuild/collection/framework/RAServer/RACommS.c (the original copy of the file has a .original file extension). These changes seem to have gotten the file server running.  After this I found that someone was calling the method ra_destroyRASTRING() with a null pointer. This was crashing the RAC when I went to do the "Analyze for leaks" (i.e., when the file copy happened). This was a simple update to RACommon/RAComm.c to make sure the passed in value was not NULL. (Again, this is also updated on toras3rm). This was the quick fix... the method really shouldn't be called with a null pointer ... is the file server code doing this somewhere?  So after the above changes, I got to the point where when I do the "Analyse for Leaks" I actually see a nonzero file being copied to workspace\ProfileProject\leakanalysisheapdir on my local machine. So the file copy is now sort of working. I say sort of because the "Analyse for Leaks" operation now seems to hang on the workbench with the "in progress" graphic at the bottom right of the screen continuously going without ever finishing.  I would need someone else to take a look at this with me at this point to figure out what's going wrong.  [reply] Comment 3 Anandi Krishnamurthy 2004-06-04 19:24:50 EDT Robert, my changes to fix the optHeaps for AS400 have not been checked in. So the heap files that are getting generated are not correct. Which is one reason why leak analysis is failing for you.  If you look in the project directory in your workspace, you should see a subdirectory named leakanalysisheapdir. This is where we save the optHeap files. If the files are copied over to this directory and the sizes etc. match, then RAC File Copy is OK.  Sample workspace dir: D:\ews\runtime-workspace\ProfilingProject8  Also, I am planning to check in my AS400 changes over the weekend. I just got the go-ahead for that.    [reply] Comment 4 Piyush Agarwal 2004-07-12 22:47:50 EDT The file has been modified to call the generic method to return method id  [reply] Comment 5 Paul Slauenwhite 2009-06-30 12:29:05 EDT As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. summary: profile/detach/attach/captureheapdump causes crash
description: profile/detach/attach/captureheapdump causes crash [reply] Description Geary Ridings 2004-05-27 17:58:10 EDT Here's the sequence: Start profiling with a profiling mode that doesn't contain Opt Heap (say Method level coverage). Detach the agent. Do Run->Profile... attach this time with profiling set that uses Opt Heap, e.g. Leak Detection Manual heap dumps. Start monitoring, and capture heapdump. java.exe crashes with The application accessed memory that could not be read.  [reply] Comment 1 Robert Danek 2004-05-28 15:49:02 EDT What driver/build are you using? There was a problem with "detach" that got into one of the M9 drivers that was fixed in a later driver (see bug 62138).  Also, I'm not familiar with using optHeap mode. Is there anything in addition to the regular Hyades build (on the UI side) that I need in order to choose the profiling set that uses "Opt Heap - Leak Detection manual heap dumps"? I don't believe the regular Hyades install has these options.  [reply] Comment 2 Geary Ridings 2004-05-28 16:31:24 EDT You need the 2 leak analysis plugins to reproduce this bug. Please go to http://pplus-web-1.cupertino.ibm.com/bluerat_build/ and download the latest versions of the following 2 plugins:  com.ibm.rational.pd.leak.analysis com.ibm.rational.pd.leak.ui  The driver came from hyades.runtime_3.0_20040526_2302.zip in a recent nightly build.  [reply] Comment 3 Robert Danek 2004-05-28 16:40:44 EDT The bug is fixed in the build that you mentioned, but I'm still a bit concerned about the driver that you are running... when you say "The driver came from hyades.runtime_3.0_20040526_2302.zip in a recent nightly build," the thing is, the piAgent.dll  does not ship with the hyades.runtime_3.0_*.zip file (nor does any of the other datacollection components). You need to also download hyadesdc.win_ia32.zip that is associated with the nightly build. To confirm, is this actually the case, or is it possible that you are picking up a different piAgent.dll that was already previously installed on your machine?  [reply] Comment 4 Robert Danek 2004-05-31 10:30:01 EDT I tried accessing  http://pplus-web-1.cupertino.ibm.com/bluerat_build/ as mentioned in comment #2 so that I could download the required plugins and try reproducing the problem. Unfortunately, I am not able to access pplus-web-1.cupertino.ibm.com. This site must be buried somewhere behind a firewall, since I can't even ping it. Could you make the required plugins available on another site? Thanks.  [reply] Comment 5 Robert Danek 2004-06-01 16:16:07 EDT I've reproduced the problem, and attached the visual C++ debugger to catch where the crash is originating.  The problem seems to be in StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp (in the datacollection package under collectors/native/java_profiler.) In particular, it is in the following segment of code:   -------------------------start code snippet ------------ extern "C" int StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_handleHeapSnapshot_FromC(JNIEnv*      env, int          dump_level, char*        begin, char*        end) { /* Need to check if header has to be written */ /* or moves and frees file need to be closed */ int errorCode = 0 ; try { switch (_filler->mode() ) {         **** <----   _filler == NULL!! case Header : _filler->writeHeaderFile() ; break ; case MovesAndFrees : _filler->closeMovesAndFreesFile() ; break ; } -------------------------end code snippet ------------  The _filler variable is NULL, so when the heap dump is being done, the jvm crashes. Now, why is _filler == NULL?  I did some digging and it turns out that _filler is initialized in the method StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_setup_FromC() (also in the StatelessHeapSnapshotManager_C.cpp file). But this setup method is only called once from JVM_OnLoad() (in JvmpiWriter.c), and only if the trace mode is TraceOptimizedHeap. Since, in the given scenario, we do not launch in TraceOptimizedHeap mode, it turns out that the required setup method is never called. So when you reattach in the TraceOptimizedHeap mode, you crash.  The way StatelessHeapSnapshotManager is setup/initialized needs to be improved to take into account that people may detach and reattach at some later point in the TraceOptimizedHeap mode (even though they launched in a different, unrelated mode).  I'm going to await word from Tanuj on who I should reassign this bug to on the Cupertino team... .  [reply] Comment 6 Robert Danek 2004-06-01 16:22:38 EDT reassigning per above comment.  [reply] Comment 7 Richard Duggan 2004-06-03 13:34:48 EDT Where are we on this?  is this only a normal severity?   I am expecting this to be major.  Please advise ASAP.  [reply] Comment 8 Tanuj Vohra 2004-06-03 14:59:23 EDT This is not critical. It's not a common usecase. We're working on it - but with a lower priority.   [reply] Comment 9 Anandi Krishnamurthy 2004-07-21 22:29:16 EDT  This bug causes the Attach with trace mode of optHeap to crash. This is a common use case and must be fixed.  Giridhar Sreenivasamurthy from Bangalore has a fix for this, that builds on Robert's initial analysis.  [reply] Comment 10 Piyush Agarwal 2004-07-29 00:29:14 EDT Giridhar Sreenivasamurthy from Bangalore has fixed this.  [reply] Comment 11 Paul Slauenwhite 2009-06-30 12:29:18 EDT As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. summary: Provide static/rules log file parser to import Java Logging XML log files.
description: Provide static/rules log file parser to import Java Logging XML log files. [reply] Description Paul Slauenwhite 2004-10-29 13:29:59 EDT Provide static/rules log file parser to import Java Logging XML log files.  The Java Logging implementation of JSR-047 provide a formatter to convert LogRecords to XML.  Since Hyades provides support for Java Logging (see org.eclipse.hyades.logging.java14), we should provide a static/rules log file parser to map Log Record XML fragments to Common Base Events using the mapping in the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.java14.XmlFormatter.  Below is the DTD for the JSR-047 formatter:   <!-- DTD used by the java.util.logging.XMLFormatter --> <!-- This provides an XML formatted log message. -->  <!-- The document type is "log" which consists of a sequence of record elements --> <!ELEMENT log (record*)>  <!-- Each logging call is described by a record element. --> <!ELEMENT record (date, millis, sequence, logger?, level, class?, method?, thread?, message, key?, catalog?, param*, exception?)>  <!-- Date and time when LogRecord was created in ISO 8601 format --> <!ELEMENT date (#PCDATA)>  <!-- Time when LogRecord was created in milliseconds since midnight January 1st, 1970, UTC. --> <!ELEMENT millis (#PCDATA)>  <!-- Unique sequence number within source VM. --> <!ELEMENT sequence (#PCDATA)>  <!-- Name of source Logger object. --> <!ELEMENT logger (#PCDATA)>  <!-- Logging level, may be either one of the constant names from java.util.logging.Constants (such as "SEVERE" or "WARNING") or an integer value such as "20". --> <!ELEMENT level (#PCDATA)>  <!-- Fully qualified name of class that issued logging call, e.g. "javax.marsupial.Wombat". --> <!ELEMENT class (#PCDATA)>  <!-- Name of method that issued logging call. It may be either an unqualified method name such as "fred" or it may include argument type information in parenthesis, for example "fred(int,String)". --> <!ELEMENT method (#PCDATA)>  <!-- Integer thread ID. --> <!ELEMENT thread (#PCDATA)>  <!-- The message element contains the text string of a log message. --> <!ELEMENT message (#PCDATA)>  <!-- If the message string was localized, the key element provides the original localization message key. --> <!ELEMENT key (#PCDATA)>  <!-- If the message string was localized, the catalog element provides the logger's localization resource bundle name. --> <!ELEMENT catalog (#PCDATA)>  <!-- If the message string was localized, each of the param elements provides the String value (obtained using Object.toString()) of the corresponding LogRecord parameter. --> <!ELEMENT param (#PCDATA)>  <!-- An exception consists of an optional message string followed by a series of StackFrames. Exception elements are used for Java exceptions and other java Throwables. --> <!ELEMENT exception (message?, frame+)>  <!-- A frame describes one line in a Throwable backtrace. --> <!ELEMENT frame (class, method, line?)>  <!-- an integer line number within a class's source file. --> <!ELEMENT line (#PCDATA)>  [reply] Comment 1 Dave Smith 2005-01-19 00:59:52 EST Can't contain work in 4.0  [reply] Comment 2 Dave Smith 2005-02-07 02:01:07 EST Theme: Appealing to the Broader Community  [reply] Comment 3 Ruth Lee 2005-02-21 18:53:29 EST Changing Version/Target to 4.0 because it is one of the features committed for 4.0. You can see the official feature list here: http://eclipse.org/tptp/home/project_info/featureplans/features.php?source=All&project=All&release=4.0&file=TPTPFeatures_4.xml  [reply] Comment 4 Paul Slauenwhite 2005-02-23 12:22:19 EST Created attachment 18247 [details] Sample adapter file.  NOTE: The enclosed sample adapter file does not strictly follow the mapping in org.eclipse.hyades.logging.java14.XmlFormatter and does not include support for the following elements:  -key -catalog -param -exception  [reply] Comment 5 Ruth Lee 2005-02-23 17:01:41 EST Submitting to the 4.1 "Active Review" list, which can be read here: http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/indextools.cgi/~checkout~/hyades-home/docs/unapproveddrafts/project%20info/plans/3+/TPTPFeatures.html  [reply] Comment 6 Ruth Lee 2005-07-12 10:58:20 EDT Deferring from 4.1 as per the official 4.1 enhancement plan. http://eclipse.org/tptp/home/project_info/featureplans/features.php?source=All&project=All&release=4.1&file=TPTPFeatures_4.1.xml  [reply] Comment 7 Paul Slauenwhite 2005-11-14 08:09:26 EST Created attachment 29858 [details] Sample log file #1.  [reply] Comment 8 Paul Slauenwhite 2005-11-14 08:10:22 EST Created attachment 29859 [details] Sample log file #2.  [reply] Comment 9 Paul Slauenwhite 2005-11-14 08:12:10 EST Created attachment 29860 [details] Sample adapter file #1.  [reply] Comment 10 Paul Slauenwhite 2005-11-14 08:12:20 EST Created attachment 29861 [details] Sample adapter file #2.  [reply] Comment 11 Rohit Shetty 2005-12-06 12:39:39 EST Created attachment 31216 [details] Patch  [reply] Comment 12 Rohit Shetty 2005-12-06 12:53:21 EST The attached Patch contains all the required modifications .i.e. the static parser, plugin entries etc.  [reply] Comment 13 Dave Smith 2005-12-06 13:01:16 EST Targetting this to 4.2 because Rohit has done the development work and attached a patch.  [reply] Comment 14 Dave Smith 2005-12-06 13:09:09 EST New logParser extension contributes properties that are shown in the Log Import Wizard and need to be translated.  [reply] Comment 15 Rohit Shetty 2005-12-07 01:17:53 EST Created attachment 31274 [details] Patch  Patch generated by the "Create Patch" command  [reply] Comment 16 Dave Smith 2005-12-07 10:38:00 EST Cadidate for 4.2  [reply] Comment 17 Dave Smith 2006-01-26 15:56:30 EST Committed changes to TPTP Head CVS.  The following new files were added to the org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers plugin:  src/org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.JavaLoggingXMLLogParser.java src/org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.internal.util.JavaLoggingSAXHandler.java config/XML/Java/logging/v1.4/example.log config/XML/Java/logging/v1.4/run_example.bat config/XML/Java/logging/v1.4/run_example.sh config/XML/Java/logging/v1.4/static_example.adapter config/XML/Java/logging/v1.4/static.adapter  The following files were changed: src/org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.Parser.java src/org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.ParserConstants.java src/org.eclipse.hyades.logging.parsers.ParserUtilities.java plugin.xml - logParser and logParserSet extensions were added for this parser plugin.properties  [reply] Comment 18 Paul Slauenwhite 2006-03-06 11:33:13 EST Verified in the TPTP-4.2.0-200602281515 driver. summary: Add support to GLA for no situationType abstract  class rules in adapter
description: Add support to GLA for no situationType abstract  class rules in adapter [reply] Description Dave Smith 2004-11-01 02:59:28 EST The GLA editor no longer creates a rule for situationType abstract CBE element.   Therefore, the CBEFormatter GLA class needs to be changed to support adapter files with and without this element in the IDirectedGraph paths.  Also, when a situationType rule exists in the adapter file, the user can use the childChoice attribute to prune the situation type parsing rules.  When the situationType element doesn't exist, childChoice can't be specified on the situation element because the required categoryName element must be present, as well as a particular situation type element.  But the categoryName value must match the particular situation type, so this value can be generated by the CBEFormatter when a situation type rule is processed.  Therefore, if CBEFormatter is changed to set the categoryName automatically, rules for categoryName are not required and the user can set the childChoice attribute on the situation element.  [reply] Comment 1 Dave Smith 2004-11-01 05:48:50 EST Committed fix to Head  [reply] Comment 2 Paul Slauenwhite 2009-06-30 09:33:05 EDT As of TPTP 4.6.0, TPTP is in maintenance mode and focusing on improving quality by resolving relevant enhancements/defects and increasing test coverage through test creation, automation, Build Verification Tests (BVTs), and expanded run-time execution. As part of the TPTP Bugzilla housecleaning process (see http://wiki.eclipse.org/Bugzilla_Housecleaning_Processes), this enhancement/defect is verified/closed by the Project Lead since this originator of this enhancement/defect has an inactive Bugzilla account and considered to be fixed. If this enhancement/defect is still unresolved and reproducible in the latest TPTP release (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/), please re-open. summary: [SSH2] Properties problems
description: [SSH2] Properties problems [reply] Description C. Lamont Gilbert 2004-11-10 11:47:29 EST 1.  The changes in properties 'SSH2 Connections Method' section are not accepted by any new or current repository locations until I restart Eclipse.  2.  The SSH2 system appears to append the 'Private Key' entry onto the end of the 'SSH2 Home' entry.  But the 'Private Key' file dialog does not consider this when it sets the resultant path into the entry box.  Thus its my belief this double path is causing authentication failures. i.e.  SSH2 Home: c:\putty Private Key: C:\putty\privKey System thinks the path is "C:\putty\c:\putty\privkey' or something like that  All tests I have done by setting values in these two boxes and creating different file system structures lead me to believe this is true.    Workaround:  1. Set the path to the directory that holds your key file in 'SSH2 Home' entry. 2. Set the filename of your private key file in 'Private Key' entry. 3. Restart Eclipse.  [reply] Comment 1 Atsuhiko Yamanaka 2005-02-16 10:15:33 EST >1. summary: Building JSR 175 annotation into binding and exposing them through DOM
description:
Building JSR 175 annotation into binding and exposing them through DOM [reply] Description Theodora Yeung 2005-04-05 14:54:42 EDT The following is an outline for injecting annotation information into the type system bindings and making it available to DOM API users. Please comment and forward to a wider audience as necessary. 1)org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.env.IBinaryAnnotation objects will be created when the class file is first read. Just like the IBinaryType and IBinaryField objects inside the jdt compiler. 2)org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.env.IBinaryAnnotation will be turned into an org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.Annotation at the same time when a IBinaryType is turned into a BinaryTypeBinding which occur during LookupEnvironment.createBinaryTypeFrom(IBinaryType, ...). 3)Also proposing a new class named "AnnotationBuilder", which has a similar role to the "BindingResolver" as both are responsible for turning the internal presentation of type system objects into the DOM version for public consumption. This propsed approached is very similar to how binary types are injected into the system. /* * New API added to * org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.env.IBinaryType, * org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.env.IBinaryMethod * org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.env.IBinaryField */ public IBinaryAnnotation[] getAnnotations(); /** * This represents the data structure that would hold class file information * about each annotation instance. * This is parallel to {@link IBinaryType}, {@link IBinaryMethod} and * {@link IBinaryField}. * * Belongs in package "org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.env". * Implementation of this interface will reside in package * "org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.classfmt" and will be created at the * same time when the class file is first read. */ public interface IBinaryAnnotation { /** * @return the fully qualified name of the annotation type. */ char[] getTypeName(); /** * @return the list of member value pairs of the annotation */ IBinaryMemberValuePair[] getMemberValuePairs(); } /** * This represents the data structure that would hold class file information * about a member value pair of an annotaiton. * * Belongs in package "org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.env". * Implementation of this interface will reside in package * "org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.classfmt" */ public interface IBinaryMemberValuePair { /** @return the name of the member */ char[] getMemberName(); /** * Return * {@link org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.impl.Constant} for compile-time * constant of type int, float, char, String etc. * Return * {@link org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.env.IBinaryField} for enum * constant. * Return * {@link org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.env.IAnnotation} for * annotation type. * Return char[] for member of {@link java.lang.Class} type * which contains the name of the type referenced. * Return Object[] for array type. * @return the value of this member value pair */ Object getMemberValue(); } /* * Adding the following APT to * org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.Binding */ /** * @return the annotations that annotated this binding. */ Annotation[] getAnnotations(); /** * This is the API that presents an unified view of binary and source * anntotation. * This is also the API that will represent annotations in the type system * bindings. * * Belongs in package {@link org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup} */ public class Annotation { /** * @return the type of the annotation. */ org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.ReferenceBinding getAnnotationType() { throw new UnsupportedOperationException("NYI"); } /** * @return the list of member value pairs of the annotation */ AnnotationMemberValuePair[] getMemberValuePairs() { throw new UnsupportedOperationException("NYI"); } } /** * This is the API that presents an unified view of binary and source * anntotation member value pairs. * * Belongs in package {@link org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup} */ public class AnnotationMemberValuePair { /** * @return the method binding that declared this member value pair */ org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.MethodBinding getMethodBinding() { throw new UnsupportedOperationException("NYI"); } /** * Return {@link org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.impl.Constant} for * compile-time constant of type int, float, char, String etc. * Return {@link org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.FieldBinding} * for enum constant. * Return {@link org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.Annotation} for * annotation type. * Return {@link org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.TypeBinding} for * member of {@link java.lang.Class} type. * Return Object[] for array type. * @return the value of this member value pair */ Object getMemberValue() { throw new UnsupportedOperationException("NYI"); } } Propose DOM API to expose JSR 175 annoation to clients. /* * New API added to org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.IBinding */ /** * @return the JSR 175 annotations that annotate the binding. */ public IAnnotation[] getAnnotations(); /** * Represents an instance of JSR 175 that appears in source or from binary. * Belong to package {@link org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom} */ public interface IAnnotation{ /** * @return the type of the annotation. */ public ITypeBinding getType(); /** * @return the array of declared member value pairs of the annotation. */ public IMemberPair[] getDeclaredMemberPairs(); } /** * Belong to package {@link org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom} */ public interface IMemberPair { /** * @return the name of the member */ public String getName(); /** * Returns the compile-time constant value of the member value pair, * if one is available. * This may return null if bindings are not requested when * the DOM/AST is being built. *

* If the type of the value is a primitive type, the result * is the boxed equivalent (i.e., int returned as an Integer); * If the type of the value is String, the result is the * string itself. * Return IVariableBinding if the value is an enum constant. * If the value is of type {@link java.lang.Class}, return * ITypeBinding * that corresponds to the type referenced through the class literal. * (i.e., return the ITypeBinding that corresponds to the * primitive type "int" if the value is "int.class".) * Return {@link IAnnotation} if the value is a JSR 175 annotation. * Return an {@link java.lang.Object} array if the value is of array type. * Return null if the value is not a compile-time constant. *

* * @return the compile-time constant of the member value, or * null if it not have one or if bindings were not requested * when the AST was created * @since 3.1 */ public Object getValue(); } [reply] Comment 1 Theodora Yeung 2005-04-13 23:23:50 EDT Created attachment 19892 [details] Containing patches for this bug After unzipping the file, there are two directories, "ALL" and "API". The directory named "ALL" has the diff for everything that I have done. The files in there directory matches the directories under "org.eclipse.jdt.core" in CVS. The directory named "API" only has diff for new API. The subdirectory named "dom" has API diff for the dom component and the one named "compiler" has API diff for the compiler component. The individual files in there are diffs for individual java files matched by name. e.g compiler/MethodBinding.txt contains the diff for org.eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/lookup/MethodBinding.java Please review. I am still in the process of testing the new code and most likely will not pass all the required tests. The purpose of this patch is simply to get some feedback on the API as well as the implementation approach. [reply] Comment 2 Theodora Yeung 2005-04-13 23:29:14 EDT Created attachment 19893 [details] First patch for this bug (in another setup) I have added another attachment which is contains the patch itself for everything I have done in org.eclipse.jdt.core. Unlike the previous attachment, it is not a zip. This patch may include diff/patches for bug 87718 from Mike Kauffman. (We work off the same code base, outside CVS, and it is hard to generate a patch just for the work I have done.) [reply] Comment 3 Theodora Yeung 2005-04-14 13:24:47 EDT The patches attached passed all the jdt.core tests. [reply] Comment 4 Theodora Yeung 2005-04-14 17:20:55 EDT Created attachment 19925 [details] Patch for the APT branch that passes all jdt.core tests A new patch that compiles correctly under 1.4 that passes all the jdt.core tests. This patch is for APT branch of org.eclip.jdt.core. [reply] Comment 5 Jim des Rivieres 2005-04-15 01:34:26 EDT Created attachment 19927 [details] patch to o.e.jdt.core/dom (APT branch) with improvements Theodora, I've reviewed the DOM API portion of the patch. I believe the proposed API additions will give client the access they need to annotation. I have some suggested renamings and some small improvements. public interface IResolvedAnnotation ITypeBinding getAnnotationType(); IResolvedMemberValuePair[] getDeclaredMemberValuePairs(); IResolvedMemberValuePair[] getAllMemberValuePairs(); - rename from IAnnotationInstance to suggest it is resolved info like bindings - add getAllMemberValuePairs to return implicit defaulted pairs as well; the full list is what many clients will want public interface IResolvedMemberValuePair public String getName(); public IMethodBinding getMemberBinding(); public Object getValue(); - rename from IElementValuePair to suggest it is resolved info like bindings - rename getElementValue -> getValue for consistency with MemberValuePair.getValue - rename getMethodBinding -> getMemberBinding - delete getElementType; unnecessary; client can do getMemberBinding().getResultType() Annotation public IResolvedAnnotation resolveAnnotation(); CompilationUnit public ASTNode findDeclaringNode(IResolvedAnnotation resolvedAnnotation) { - fine as proposed IBinding public IResolvedAnnotation[] getAnnotations(); - pull method up from ITypeBinding, IVariableBinding, IMethodBinding so that package annotations are exposed as well - change spec to return empty list rather than null, to make it more convenient for clients IMethodBinding public IResolvedAnnotation[] getParameterAnnotations(int paramIndex); public boolean isAnnotationMember(); public Object getDefaultValue(); - rename isAnnotationMethod -> isAnnotationMember for greater consistency ( the node type is named AnnotationTypeMember) The patch is for the o.e.jdt.core/dom subtree only (APT branch) and has fleshed out specs for everything. Some of the other things I noticed - all new API needs to be tagged with @since so that we have a record when the API entered the platform. I didn't know what Philippe and you have discussed, so I marked all the new classes and method @since 3.2 on the assumption that they will appear only on 3.2. - since there is new API involved, the test suites will need to be upgraded as well to include tests for the new API elements - the implementation classes AnnotationInstance and ElementValuePair are public; since I doubt you intended these to be exposed as API, then should to be package-private - it would help if the code formatting followed the same conventions used elsewhere in JDT Core [reply] Comment 6 Theodora Yeung 2005-04-15 16:10:33 EDT Thanks for the feedback. Will adjust the API and implementation as suggested. The one question I have is what exactly should the behavior be for IPackageBinding.getAnnotations(). Unlike types, fields or methods, there may be mutiple places that declared a package. I noticed that the jdt supports the recommended way of declaring package annotation which is through package- info.java. Does this mean that IPackageBinding.getAnnotations() should only return annotations declared at the package declaration inside package- info.java? So, if in some source file where there are package annotations, these annotatons should be ignored from the perspective of IPackageBinding.getAnnotations()? I don't think the information from package-info.java is being utilized. org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.lookup.PackageBinding.getAnnotationTagBits() is always returning 0 as it didn't override the implementation at Binding. Is that correct? The reason I asked is that I am wondering how to get this piece of information back into the system. Thanks. Theodora Yeung [reply] Comment 7 Jim des Rivieres 2005-04-15 17:12:22 EDT The discussion section in JLS3 7.4.1.1 strongly recommends that the package declaration inside package-info.java be consider the only legitimate place to annotate a package declaration. So IPackageBinding.getAnnotations() should return those annotations. Frederic, perhaps you could take a look at the what's happing to the package annotations in the compiler. [reply] Comment 8 Philipe Mulet 2005-04-16 02:52:44 EDT The compiler never needs the annotation info for package anywhere; only use could be to feed some downstream tools appropriately. [reply] Comment 9 Jim des Rivieres 2005-04-16 20:23:25 EDT A tool would expect to be able to access package annotations if there are any. How difficult would it be to retain the information when the package-info.java is compiled? [reply] Comment 10 Theodora Yeung 2005-04-18 22:20:04 EDT I believe today, when package-info.java gets compiled, package-info.class gets generated. The annotation information is held by the by the synthetic type "package-info". The problem I have tody is not knowing how to retrieve this information back out from inside the compiler. I think if "package-info" is in binary form the problem can easily be solved. I Could simply go look for the type name "package-info" with the proper package name. However, if package-info.java exists, i.e. the package info is in source, then this approach would fail. The NameEnvironment would find the file and be able to create the proper compilation unit. However, the type does not actually exist in source, and the search fail. It seems like I am going around this problem the wrong way. Is there anyway to look for a file and parse it from the LookupEnvironment? [reply] Comment 11 Philipe Mulet 2005-04-19 04:03:29 EDT We could imagine having the DOM AST binding support be able to read package-info.class in order to look for annotations. This might be confusing in the presence of package-info.java as well. Note that in the latter case, one can use the DOM AST to find out about source annotations. [reply] Comment 12 Theodora Yeung 2005-05-18 20:37:50 EDT Proposeadding IResolvedMemberValuePair.isDefault(). This will be particularly useful when client iterate over the array of member value pairs that they obtain from IResolvedAnnotation.getAllMemberValuePairs() [reply] Comment 13 Jim des Rivieres 2005-05-19 08:31:25 EDT Adding IResolvedMemberValuePair.isDefault() would make good sense. [reply] Comment 14 Theodora Yeung 2005-08-04 16:34:12 EDT Work is completed and checked into CVS. closing. [reply] Comment 15 Theodora Yeung 2005-10-20 18:24:13 EDT Closing all completed bugs reports [reply] Comment 16 Theodora Yeung 2005-10-20 18:24:31 EDT - [reply] Comment 17 Philipe Mulet 2006-02-03 11:30:49 EST *** Bug 90886 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. *** [reply] Comment 18 Frederic Fusier 2006-04-14 10:43:11 EDT This was fixed in 3.1 APT branch... [reply] Comment 19 Frederic Fusier 2006-04-14 10:48:17 EDT Wrong change, changes was done in JDT/Core component. However, we have no input in buildnotes as it was done in APT branch. Set target as 3.1 but does not reflect the reality... Add Comment Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

Special NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT comment should be added.   115: For files with a "115" error, add this comment to the start of the file # NLS_ENCODING=UTF-8  119: For files with a "119" error, see if the file should be translated, and if not, once the errors in any other files are fixed, then transfer this defect to the build team so that they can exclude the file from the translation check.  920: For files with a "920" error, add one of the following comments to the file to indicate what type of single quote handling should be used: # NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_ALL # NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE # NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_VAR Choose which comment to use based on this criteria: NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_ALL Each string is assumed to be processed by the java.text.MessageFormat class (single quote must be coded as 2 consecutive single quotes ''). NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE All strings are assumed to NOT be processed by the java.text.MessageFormat class (single quote must be coded as 1 single quote '). NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_VAR Strings which contain replacement variables are processed by the MessageFormat class (single quote must be coded as 2 consecutive single quotes ''). Strings which do NOT contain replacement variables are NOT processed by the MessageFormat class (single quote must be coded as 1 single quote ').  964: For files with a "964" error, ensure that the correct encoding is specified: <?xml  encoding="UTF-8"  version="1.0" ?>  [reply] Comment 1 Samson Wai 2005-06-08 12:16:17 EDT Fixed SetConfig.properties as requested. Special NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT comment should be added.   115: For files with a "115" error, add this comment to the start of the file # NLS_ENCODING=UTF-8  119: For files with a "119" error, see if the file should be translated, and if not, once the errors in any other files are fixed, then transfer this defect to the build team so that they can exclude the file from the translation check.  920: For files with a "920" error, add one of the following comments to the file to indicate what type of single quote handling should be used: # NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_ALL # NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE # NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_VAR Choose which comment to use based on this criteria: NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_ALL Each string is assumed to be processed by the java.text.MessageFormat class (single quote must be coded as 2 consecutive single quotes ''). NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE All strings are assumed to NOT be processed by the java.text.MessageFormat class (single quote must be coded as 1 single quote '). NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_VAR Strings which contain replacement variables are processed by the MessageFormat class (single quote must be coded as 2 consecutive single quotes ''). Strings which do NOT contain replacement variables are NOT processed by the MessageFormat class (single quote must be coded as 1 single quote ').  964: For files with a "964" error, ensure that the correct encoding is specified: <?xml  encoding="UTF-8"  version="1.0" ?>  [reply] Comment 1 Ruth Lee 2005-06-08 11:09:39 EDT Sorry, I posted the wrong CHKPII errors here. These are the ones, for report.core and report.samples. Please disregard the initial text of this bugzilla.  plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.report.samples/input/ line.xml      XML-10      969   (W) XML tag attribute (label) may contain translatable text which cannot be translated. Required CHARSET value must be defined in this file.  plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.report.core/src/org/eclipse/tptp/platform/report/chart/svg/internal/input/ package.html  HTML-32     833   Missing META tag.  Required CHARSET value must be defined in this file.  plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.report.core/src/org/eclipse/tptp/platform/report/chart/svg/internal/input/ package.html  HTML-32     833   Missing META tag.  Required CHARSET value must be defined in this file.  To fix the problems, please do the following:  115: For files with a "115" error, add this comment to the start of the file # NLS_ENCODING=UTF-8  833: For files with a "833" error, correct the meta tag in the file to the following: <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">  920: For files with a "920" error, add one of the following comments to the file to indicate what type of single quote handling should be used: # NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_ALL # NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE # NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_VAR Choose which comment to use based on this criteria: NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_ALL Each string is assumed to be processed by the java.text.MessageFormat class (single quote must be coded as 2 consecutive single quotes ''). Strings which do NOT contain replacement variables are NOT processed by the MessageFormat class (single quote must be coded as 1 single quote ').  969: If the file should not be translated then transfer the bugzilla to the "Build" component. If the file should be translated then ask Ruth for help.    [reply] Comment 2 Sheldon Lee-Loy 2005-06-10 09:01:45 EDT the contents of report.core and report.samples plugin should not be translated. summary: Reloading the genmodel from ecore is broken because GenOperationImpl .initialize has index out of bounds error
description: Reloading the genmodel from ecore is broken because GenOperationImpl .initialize has index out of bounds error [reply] Description Bryan Hunt 2005-06-10 00:22:46 EDT Build I200506091102  Reloading a genmodel from an ecore file is very broken.  Here are the details:  Select a genmodel, right click and select Reload... Select EMF ecore model Click Next Nothing happens Click Next Error dialog appears saying that you need to select an ecore model Dismiss the error dialog The Model URI field will be empty - it used to contain the paths to the ecore files that were previously loaded The Generator model file name field will be empty - it should default to the selected genmodel  If you fill in the Model URI, and the genmodel name, you can get to the next page Select the packages, add the referenced generator models and select the appropriate referenced packages Click Finish You get a NPE   If you are able to reproduce this, any chance you could spin another integration build with the fix?  [reply] Comment 1 Ed Merks 2005-06-10 07:09:33 EDT Bryan,  No I can't reproduce this (in my develop environment nor in a fresh install of RC1 and the latest EMF driver). It sounds to me like you have a bad installation. Have you tried running with -clean.  Note that we moved to using manifests in this build, and some folks are seeing strange access errors and failures to load classes when they update an existing installation.  If your problem persists with clean installation, please show the stack traces in the .log and reopen the bugzilla.  We likely also need the sample files you are reloading as well, i.e., the .genmodel and .ecore...  [reply] Comment 2 Ed Merks 2005-06-10 13:46:56 EDT Bryan,  I encountered this problem:  !STACK 0 org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$BasicIndexOutOfBoundsException: index=1, size=1 at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java) at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$BasicIndexOutOfBoundsException.<init>(BasicEList.java:494) at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.get(BasicEList.java) at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenOperationImpl.initialize(GenOperationImpl.java:585)  which reveals a long standing but in GenOperationImpl.initialize.  It's very easy to fix.  I'll reopen this bugzilla to fix it, I'll attach the .class file so that you can patch your driver, and I'll downgrade the severity since you'll have a workaround.  You also seem to have a broken Ecore reference from prog/Program/execute/executionHarness to its type.  [reply] Comment 3 Ed Merks 2005-06-10 13:49:24 EDT Created attachment 22820 [details] Compiled fix for problem  This class can be used to patch org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.  [reply] Comment 4 Ed Merks 2005-06-10 13:50:01 EDT The fix is commited to CVS.  [reply] Comment 5 Nick Boldt 2005-06-16 03:48:05 EDT Fixed in build 2.1.0 I200506160200 (Eclipse 3.1 RC2).  [reply] Comment 6 Bryan Hunt 2005-06-16 11:34:36 EDT I just installed the new integration build, and I've run into this problem again.  It's with a different project/genmodel, but same error log.  [reply] Comment 7 Bryan Hunt 2005-06-16 11:40:35 EDT My bad, I just realized that the latest download on the download page is not the latest integration build.  It's one build behind.  [reply] Comment 8 Nick Boldt 2008-01-28 16:46:36 EST Move to verified as per bug 206558.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

Click on the Show Advanced button (assuming that Geronimo is not the default server) 1c. Select Geronimo V1.0 (Generic) as the Server 1d. Click on "Finish"  2. Switch to the J2EE Perspective  3. For Project TestEJB, create an EJB Module (New->J2EE EJB Module) 3a. The name of the module will be "TestEJBModule" 3b. Leave all defaults (creation of client, annotation, etc) unchanged 3c. summary: APT reconcile loop
description: APT reconcile loop [reply] Description Gary Horen 2005-06-20 21:29:50 EDT Repro: 1. Build APT branch (see org.eclipse.jdt.apt.core/howtobuildme.txt). 2. Into the built workspace, import attached demo.zip. This contains annotation processor for TypeGeneratingAnnotation. 3. Debug workspace into which attached demoUserProject.zip has been imported. 4. Open demo.Quack.java in user project. 5. Uncomment import and reference to GeneratedFileTest type. 6. Add and remove the @TypeGeneratingAnnotation to/from the class.  Manifestations: 1. When you add @TypeGeneratingAnnotation to the Quack class (and sometimes when you remove same), the workspace will build over and over again, and the generated type will appear and disappear from the project. 2. When you save the file, the looping behavior will stop, in either the annotation add or remove case. So apparently this only happens on the recomcile code path. 3. If you remove the references to the generated type (both the import and reference) the problem goes away.  [reply] Comment 1 Gary Horen 2005-06-20 21:31:16 EDT Created attachment 23589 [details] source code for annotation processors  [reply] Comment 2 Gary Horen 2005-06-20 21:32:10 EDT Created attachment 23590 [details] source file to repro the bug (Quack.java)  [reply] Comment 3 Mike Kaufman 2005-06-21 19:42:16 EDT  This seems to be caused by reconcile triggering a build, and build triggering a reconcile, and on & on.  Gary, for a quick work-around, disable auto-build on your project.  [reply] Comment 4 Mike Kaufman 2005-06-22 14:47:06 EDT  Dropping severity since there is a work-around.  [reply] Comment 5 Mike Kaufman 2005-08-02 17:13:00 EDT  Should now be fixed since reconcile type-generation only works on in-memory copies, and doesn't touch disk.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Deadlock between Resource (or model?) listener and GeneratedFileManager
description: Deadlock between Resource (or model?) listener and GeneratedFileManager [reply] Description Mike Kaufman 2005-06-27 17:30:45 EDT The resource or model (can't remember) listener, and the GeneratedFileManager are deadlocking when building the Petstore Demo (see setup instructions below).  Repro:  1.  Disable reconcile-path APT to dispatch 2.  Rebuild Petstore project. 3.  Note deadlock.  The beehive project .zip files are too large to upload to bugzilla, so please contact me (mkaufman@bea.com) with info on where to get them from.    Setup Instructions for Beehive Petstore Demo --------------------------------------------  1.  WTP-enable your eclipse installation.  You'll need to drop the following plugins into your eclipse\plugins directory.  6/17 I-build of WTP - http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/I-I20050617- 200506171814/wtp-I20050617.zip 6/9 build of EMF    - http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drivers/emf-sdo-xsd-SDK- I200506091102.zip RC1 of GEF 3.1      - http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drivers/GEF-SDK-3.1RC1.zip JME 1.1 M2          - http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drivers/JEM-SDK-1.1M2.zip  2.  Get the org.eclipse.beehive and org.eclipse.beehive.zip & org.eclipse.beehive.ide.eclipse.core.zip plugins from the file share, and exppand them onto your hard-drive 3.  Import these projects into your workspace that contains the apt projects 4.  Launch a debug instance of eclipse from this workspace. 5.  Get the J1Petstore.zip and JDBCControlSample.zip files from the file share, and extract them onto your filesystem. 6.  Import these projects into your debug workspace. 7.  Beehive-enable your projects, for J1Petstore and JDBCControlSample a) right-click the project, and then choose Add/Remove Beehive support b) open the .project file and make sure that the beehive builder has been removed c) right-click the project and then choose Add/Remove Beehive support again d) got to "Project | Properties | Java Annotaiton Processing ", and then choose the "apply" button, and then choose the "OK" button. (this will cause the options to be persisted)  7.  Do a clean build of the J1Petstore project (note the many bugs and crappy performance) 8.  Do a clean build of the JDBCControlSample project (note the many bugs and crappy performance)  Note that the JDBCControlSample project is a smaller project, and builds more quickly than J1Petstore project.  Also note that there are some nasty bugs here.  You may need to disable the reconcile-time apt dispatch (see APTDispatch.java), and disable the resource & model listeners (see the GeneratedFileManager's init() method)  [reply] Comment 1 Mike Kaufman 2005-07-07 20:30:34 EDT  I think the fix here is to wrap up calls into GeneatedFileManager with an IWorkspaceRunnable class.  We should use the workspace-root as the ISchedulingRule, or possibly use a series of operations, one for each project.  At any rate, it would be good to stop synchronzing on the GeneratedFileManager instance, and start using the Eclipse resource locks.  APTDispatch during reconcile is TBD, since we've got scheduling problems around the lock taken by a save or saveAs operation (file or project-level lock), and the lock required by JavaModelOperations necessary to get a compilation unit (workspace-level lock).  [reply] Comment 2 Mike Kaufman 2005-07-12 16:45:32 EDT  Fixed this by making sure we weren't holding the GeneratedFileManager's lock when doing any operations that would take a different lock (e.g, java model operations or resource operations).  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Return value of AnnotationValue.getValue()  when types don't line up
description: Return value of AnnotationValue.getValue()  when types don't line up [reply] Description Theodora Yeung 2005-07-08 21:30:34 EDT Foo.java public @interface Foo { String[] name(); }  Test.java @Foo("values") // AnnotationValue.getValue() should return String or String[]? public class Bar{}  Other questions: What happen if there is a complete type mismatch between the declaration and the actual annotation member value? Return null? Or should simply return what's in source regardless of the type declared?  [reply] Comment 1 Theodora Yeung 2005-07-11 19:11:20 EDT Fix checked into CVS as of July 11, 2005 4:07pm.  APT implementation will assure that return type of AnnoationValue.getValue() line up with that in the declaration when there are no errors.  In the example below, auto boxing will be performed in the return value. Type widening and narrowing will also be performed when possible. If the type is not convertible, the return type will depends on the value in source. Sun's implementation always return you the String "error" but that seems counter intuitive particular when the string could actually be a valid value for some annotation value. Add the directory to the project root in windows Explorer. Refresh project in Package Explorer.  6. Clean and build again. Problem goes away.  I believe that this has to do with having an entry in the .classpath file for the project, which does not already exist on disk. summary: build errors on first build when __generared_src folder is created
description: build errors on first build when __generared_src folder is created [reply] Description Mike Kaufman 2005-07-13 20:19:51 EDT On the first build when the __generated_src folder is created, the Builder needs to have its source paths updated with the new source path information. We end up with a build error, because the builder has stale source path info.  This may only occurr if the __generated_src folder is a child of another src folder "parent".  In this case, the builder thinks that files in the __generated_src folder are rooted at the "parent", and you get a build error that the expected package is wrong.  [reply] Comment 1 Mike Kaufman 2005-07-26 18:43:16 EDT Created attachment 25332 [details] Patch for APT branch o.e.jdt.core.  Changes to o.e.jdt.apt.core are not included.  [reply] Comment 2 Mike Kaufman 2005-07-26 19:07:26 EDT  submitted changes to apt.core to get the fact that we updated the project's classpath back to AptCompilationParticipant.  When the attached patch gets submitted, we need to fix up AptCopmilationParticipant to use the new PreBuildCompilationResult constructor.  This should all be in there and all you need to do is uncomment two lines of code.  Search for "103745".   [reply] Comment 3 Mike Kaufman 2005-07-27 17:12:03 EDT  Also, there is a regression test for this bug.  When the patch is applied, enable AptBuilder#disabled_testGeneratedFileInBuilder_ProjectRootAsSourceDir() by renaming to testGeneratedFileInBuilder_ProjectRootAsSourceDir().   [reply] Comment 4 Mike Kaufman 2005-08-04 14:26:18 EDT  should be fixed.  Frederic checked in teh patch & I enabled the regression test.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Geronimo: better stop implementation
description: Geronimo: better stop implementation [reply] Description Sachin Patel 2005-07-21 17:40:05 EDT Even though Geronimo can handle properly shutdown of the server by terminating the process, in the tools server console, no info is provided by doing this way. To get detailed shutdown information in the console you need to invoke shutdown on the kernel rather then terminating the process. This can be done by the following code in GeronimoServerBehavior.stop(boolean force)....  public void stop(boolean force) { Map map = new HashMap(); map.put("jmx.remote.credentials", new String[] { getUserName(), getPassword()}); try { JMXServiceURL address = new JMXServiceURL("service:jmx:rmi://localhost/jndi/rmi:/JMXConnector"); JMXConnector jmxConnector = JMXConnectorFactory.connect(address, map); MBeanServerConnection mbServerConnection = jmxConnector.getMBeanServerConnection(); Kernel kernel = new KernelDelegate(mbServerConnection); kernel.shutdown(); } catch (MalformedURLException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } super.stop(true); }  [reply] Comment 1 Sachin Patel 2005-08-26 10:31:00 EDT Fix will be in Apache Geronimo project.  [reply] Comment 2 Tim deBoer 2005-12-13 10:31:55 EST Closing old bugs that haven't had any activity in a couple months.
