class. Any hints?  [reply] Comment 3 Wei Yan 2005-12-20 21:20:53 EST BIRT uses the rhino 1.6RC1, perhaps those two web application embeds old version rhino in their distribution.  [reply] Comment 4 Kai Shen 2005-12-23 13:23:54 EST This problem is caused by incorrect environment setting. Please see the following email that I sent to the submitter two days ago for details. ______________________________________________ From: 	Kai Shen Sent:	Wednesday, December 21, 2005 5:16 PM To:	'hpadmanabhan@mandtbank.com' Cc:	Stanley Wang Subject:	Bugzilla Bug 105853 - Report Viewer sample fails with runtime error when used on application server (JRun4)  The problem is because the application server contains a older version of Rhino's js.jar, while BIRT uses the latest version (1.6RC1). Because the js.jar in the application server is loaded before the one in BIRT, the older version of class org.mozilla.javascript.Context is loaded. Since the older version of class org.mozilla.javascript.Context doesn't contain function initStandardObjects, a runtime java.lang.NoSuchMethodError happened.  To solve this kind of problem, the application server usually provides a configuration to allow loading application's java classes before the app server's.  For WebSphere, there's a class loading policy option. You need to set it to "PARENT_LAST". This will force websphere to load the classes in BIRT before WebSphere's classes. Here's the detailed description on how to set it. In the Server Configuration view or Servers view, double-click the server to open it. The server editor opens. Click the Applications tab at the bottom of the editor. In the Applications list box, select the application to modify the class loader settings. In the Classloader mode field, select the class loading mode for the application to PARENT_LAST.  For WebLogic, the weblogic.xml contains a prefer-web-inf-classes element (a sub-element of the container-descriptor element). By default, this element is set to False. You need to set it to TRUE. Setting this element to True subverts the classloader delegation model so that class definitions from the Web application are loaded in preference to class definitions in higher-level classloaders. (http://e-docs.bea.com/wls/docs81/programming/classloading.html#1082452).  For JRUN4, there's a load-system-classes-first element in in the jrun-web.xml. load-system-classes-first specifies whether system classes should be loaded before enterprise and web application classes. If the value is 'true', the system classpath is given preference over the web-app's classpath. If the value is 'false', the local web-app classpath is used to load a class or resource first and if it is not found there, then the system class path is searched. (http://livedocs.macromedia.com/jrun/4/descriptordocs/jrun-web/jrun-web.htm). By default, the value is 'true'. You need to set it to 'false'.  We've tested it in WebLogic 8.1 and WebSphere 5. Please try it out in your environment and let us know if you still have problems. We're planning to close this bug by Friday. Thanks.  Kai Shen BIRT Committer  [reply] Comment 5 Rajiv Gupta 2007-10-12 05:53:13 EDT Exception:weblogic.management.ApplicationException: prepare failed for birtTest Module: birtTest Error: Could not load birtTest: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

with JAX-WS. Unfortunately, there is a remaining difficulty, which is that the JAX-WS annotation processor stores and reads static data that prevents it from being used incrementally.  We're considering creating a compatibility mode inside our implementation allowing processors that are written in this way to function as a batch processor once per clean build.  Ian, if you could only use the JAX-WS annotation processor in Eclipse during a clean build, would that still be useful to you?  [reply] Comment 4 Ian Carr 2005-08-16 06:31:52 EDT Yes I believe so, that would be similar to the way I currently weave in the ant scripts to run APT directly. How would the configuration work? I assume the batch mode would need to be selected for particular generators only, rather than as a global setting?  [reply] Comment 5 Jess Garms 2005-08-16 20:22:25 EDT Yes, we'll need to modify the UI so that it's possible to make a particular processor or processors run only in batch mode. It won't be a global setting.  [reply] Comment 6 Theodora Yeung 2005-08-22 18:42:50 EDT Status update: APT batch dispatch support is in place. Reconcile dispatch is disabled for batch processors.  Remaining items: 1) Need UI 2) Need to bounce class loaders after clean 3) Need to generated IMarker instead of IProblem during batch dispatch.  In short, the jax-ws samples/annotations/src/annotation/server test case should work properly in eclipse at the first clean build. If there is a repro that involve only commandline APT, I would love to know about it and fix any problems that our implementation may have.  Currently, our implementation's behavior matches exactly what Sun's implementation does. The 3 client files do not get generated and resulted in compile time error on samples/annotations/client/AddNumbersClient.java.  The apt command used is as follow.  apt "-And=C:\perforce\runtime\jax-ws annotations\samples\annotations\bin" - sourcepath samples\annotations\src -s samples\annotations\genSrc -d samples\annotations\bin - classpath "samples\annotations\bin;lib\activation.jar;lib\FastInfoset.jar;lib\j axb-api.jar;lib\jaxb-impl.jar;lib\jaxb-libs.jar;lib\jaxb-xjc.jar;lib\jaxws- api.jar;lib\jaxws-rt.jar;lib\jaxws-tools.jar;lib\jsr173_api.jar;lib\jsr181- api.jar;lib\relaxngDatatype.jar;lib\saaj-api.jar;lib\saaj- impl.jar;lib\sjsxp.jar" - factorypath "samples\annotations\bin;lib\activation.jar;lib\FastInfoset.jar;lib \jaxb-api.jar;lib\jaxb-impl.jar;lib\jaxb-libs.jar;lib\jaxb-xjc.jar;lib\jaxws- api.jar;lib\jaxws-rt.jar;lib\jaxws-tools.jar;lib\jsr173_api.jar;lib\jsr181- api.jar;lib\relaxngDatatype.jar;lib\saaj-api.jar;lib\saaj- impl.jar;lib\sjsxp.jar" samples\annotations\src\annotations\server\*.java samples\annotations\src\annotations\client\*.java   Again, if there is a repro that involves only APT, I would love to know about it. (Don't know why i managed to not get any errors before.) Will be closing this bug after i check in a few changes. Cause: not catching the reflection invocation on Class type correctly.  Repro: 1) Download the rapt.jar from https://rapt.dev.java.net. 2) Create a java project in apt enabled Eclipse installation 3) Add rapt.jar to build path and factory path. 4) include the code from Radu.  package test; import net.java.dev.rapt.exploratory.anon.As;  public class as { @As(Runnable.class) void doSomething() { } }  5)Without the fix, you will get the IllegalStateException reported here. With the fix, a class call "Runnables" is generated and can be located at the generated source file directory.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

[reply] Comment 3 Theodora Yeung 2005-08-31 16:24:59 EDT Cause of the problem: In the presence of a type hierachy problem, JDT core generate a synthetic field with null being the type. summary: Load Time Weaving problem with Aspect Definition at 2 Levels of Hierarchy
description: Load Time Weaving problem with Aspect Definition at 2 Levels of Hierarchy [reply] Description Ron Bodkin 2005-09-06 22:05:34 EDT I am trying to weave into Tomcat with a system-level aspect (META-INF/aop.xml is found in a jar on the system classpath), and also have a Web application with an aop.xml properly deployed. When I try to run them both together, only the system-level aspects work. If I remove the system-level aspect jar from the classpath, the application-level aspects work. What would be a reasonable way to isolate this into a test case? If I could package up a simple system.jar and app.war file for Tomcat 5.5.9, would that be useful for you to use in debugging it? I tried making a simple standalone version with 2 aop.xml files in the same app classloader but that works just fine.  [reply] Comment 1 Adrian Colyer 2005-09-08 04:18:18 EDT tagging with M4...  [reply] Comment 2 Matthew Webster 2005-09-08 05:48:45 EDT I'm not quite sure I understand the problem: 1. When you say "weav into Tomcat" do you mean you are weaving Tomcat classes? 2. When you say "system classpath" do you you java.class.path or sun.boot.class.path 3. When you day "only the system-level aspects work" do you mean only the Tomcat classes are woven? 4. Could you send the aop.xml files? Are you explicity including/excluding classes or aspects? 5. Could you use weaver options "-verbose" and/or "-showWeavInfo" and append the resulting logs.  [reply] Comment 3 Ron Bodkin 2005-09-08 20:01:51 EDT Hi Matthew,  1) I have added a jar to the CLASSPATH used on start-up of Tomcat (but not the bootclasspath). This jar includes a META-INF/aop.xml file. So the aspects in the jar will weave into everything loaded from the AppClassLoader down. 2) java.class.path 3) The jar in the CLASSPATH weaves properly into everything in the system. Debug information shows that both it and the Web application-level jar are being recognized for the Web app, but that only it is affecting the Web app. 4) Here are the aop.xml files below 5) I will post in a follow-up  classpath agent's aop.xml <!-- FIXME fails when DTD here and call from Ant--> <!--<!DOCTYPE aspectj PUBLIC--> <!--    "-//AspectJ//DTD//EN"--> <!--    "http://www.aspectj.org/dtd/aspectj_1_5_0.dtd">--> <aspectj> <weaver options="-proceedOnError"> <!-- -showWeaveInfo -verbose --> <exclude within="com.crankj..*"/> <exclude within="org.eclipse..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.struts.util..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.catalina.core..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.catalina.cluster..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.commons..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.xerces..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.jasper..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.tomcat.util..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.catalina.util..*"/> <exclude within="edu.emory..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.juli..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.naming..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.coyote..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.catalina.storeconfig..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.jk..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.webapp..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.log4j..*"/> <exclude within="org.springframework..*"/> <!-- <exclude within="*..*CGLIB$*"/> <exclude within="$Proxy**"/> <exclude within="sun.reflect.Generated*"/> <exclude within="com.sun.jmx..*"/> --> </weaver> <aspects> <!-- see here nested class with ".", "$" is accepted as well --> <aspect name="com.crankj.monitor.ui.ServletRequestMonitor"/> <aspect name="com.crankj.monitor.ui.StrutsRequestMonitor"/> <aspect name="com.crankj.monitor.resource.JdbcMonitor"/> <aspect name="com.crankj.config.CrankjSystemInitializer"/> </aspects> </aspectj>  Web Application aop.xml file: <aspectj> <!--  <weaver options="-proceedOnError -showWeaveInfo -verbose"> --> <weaver options="-proceedOnError"> <exclude within="com.crankj..*"/> <exclude within="org.eclipse..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.commons..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.xerces..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.naming..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.catalina.storeconfig..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.jk..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.webapp..*"/> <exclude within="org.apache.log4j..*"/> <exclude within="org.springframework..*"/> </weaver> <aspects> <aspect name="com.crankj.aspects.BadSysInfluence"/> <aspect name="com.crankj.aspects.BadAppInfluence"/> </aspects> </aspectj>  [reply] Comment 4 Matthew Webster 2005-09-09 12:01:35 EDT You may be encountering a bug with class loaders that I have experienced under OSGi (now fixed). Like that environment I presume Tomcat defines it's own. The problem lies with ClassLoader.getResources() which the AspectJ weaving adaptor uses to find all the available aop.xml files; in your case 2. The bug is that it only finds the first one. You can confirm this using the lastest AspectJ 5 M3, which has lot's of new diagnostic messages, and use "- Daj.weaving.verbose=true".  [reply] Comment 5 Ron Bodkin 2005-09-22 17:19:20 EDT I found that both the aop.xml files were being found, so the issue in my case occurred later...  [reply] Comment 6 Matthew Webster 2005-09-23 08:32:59 EDT Could you append the log (or at least the relevant parts)? Do you get weaving messages for the required classes (indicating they are being processed) but no weaveInfo messages (indicating there are no matches)? I assume the classes are not in com.crankj which is excluded or org.aspectj, java or javax which are also exluded automatically.  Have you looked at stderr? If an exception occurs during weaving it will be caught in the adaptor and logged but class loading will continue. summary: Source file generated by annotation processor not updated in IDE
description: Source file generated by annotation processor not updated in IDE Description Adrian Grealish 2005-09-22 16:21:25 EDT If a developer has a source file open that is generated by an annotation processor and then changes the processor/factory that generated that file to a different annotation factory implementation (i.e. different jar file == different generated source file) the changes are not reflected in the open source file until it is closed and re-opened in the editor. The project is being rebuilt correctly but this is confusing to developers as they can't see the changes being made if they already have the generated source open. Clicking refresh in the ｀Package Explorer¨ view does not refresh the file in the editor.  Setup steps: Create simple project with simple a class that uses an annotation like @HelloWorld. Create two seperate @HelloWorld processors, one in external Jar A.jar and the other in B.jar, make sure they generate slightly different source at compile time but with the same class and package, one can print 'Hello world A.jar' the other 'Hello World B.jar'. Add them to classpath and to the Annotation Factory Path (Right click on project/Properties/Java Compiler/Annotation Processing/Factory Path/Add External Jars). Add them so A.jar is highier on the list than B.jar so A.jar will be used at compile time.  Repro Steps: Once you have set up your simple project and can see the source file generated by the @HelloWorld annotation processor found in A.jar, open the generated source file in the IDE. Now go into project properties and change the Factory path so that B.jar is higher in the Factory path and apply the changes. This means the project will be re-built with the processor found in B.jar but the generated source displayed in the open file in the editor is still showing the old source generated by A.jar. Clicking refresh on the Package Explorer view does not fix the problem. You have to close the file and reopen it to see the newly generated file by B.jar processor.  Note: When you edit a source file outside of the IDE there is a prompt advising that ｀the file has changed on the file system. Do you want to load the changes?¨  Comment 1 Jess Garms 2005-09-22 16:27:31 EDT Adrian, could you attach A.jar and B.jar to this bug if you have them handy?  Comment 2 Adrian Grealish 2005-10-17 19:23:21 EDT Created attachment 28365 [details] A.jar  This is a simple hello world Annotation factory and processor used to replicate this bug, it generates a file that contain s the phrase "A.jar". The annotation is @HelloWorldAnnotation  Comment 3 Adrian Grealish 2005-10-17 19:25:06 EDT Created attachment 28366 [details] B.jar  Same as A.jar except generates method helloWorldB() and the prints the string "Hello, (B) world!  This file produced by B.Jar"  Comment 4 Theodora Yeung 2005-10-20 17:54:41 EDT fix checked into CVS Oct 20.

summary: Generated source file marked dirty after manual edits to it and to its parent file
description: Generated source file marked dirty after manual edits to it and to its parent file [reply] Description Steven Bandow 2005-09-27 21:33:50 EDT If a user edits/saves a generated source file, then edits/saves the parent, the freshly regenerated source file will be marked as dirty.   Repro: 1. Open a project... its factory path needs to contain an annotation that will generate a source file 2. Open a java file in the project 3. Add a usage of an annotation to generate a source file, and save 4. In the generated file, make a manual edit, and save (nothing fancy, can just be a comment) 5. Back in the parent file, make an edit, and save  Bug: Child is regenerated, and the contents are correct, but it is marked as dirty. Expect freshly (re)generated files to be in a clean state.   The repro should work with any generated file / parent file combination. Attached is a version of the annotation jar from bug 110888 (simplified to generate a file that won't hit that bug too). summary: Separate DocumentArchive into ArchiveReader and ArchiveWriter
description: Separate DocumentArchive into ArchiveReader and ArchiveWriter [reply] Description Stanley Wang 2005-11-21 19:32:13 EST Currently, the IDocumentArchive interface supports both read/write. As a result, if there is an init method, it would be different for reader/writer, because in reader, one may have to first decompress a file; Similarly, a finalize method would also work differently. Also, the reader needs a set of getXXX and listXXX functions, but the writer only needs a set of createXXX functions.  The proposal is the separate the interface into two, one for reader and one for writer. The interface has been checked in to BIRT.core. Implementation classes need to be provided.  Classes that currently use the archive interface should be updated sccordingly.  There also needs to be a factory class in BIRT.core to generate an archive, so that users of the API do not need to directly call "new DocumentArchive()", which exposes implementation detail. Once you have a factory, in fact, it is possible to have one implementation class that implements both without exposing unwanted functions.  [reply] Comment 1 Kai Shen 2005-12-08 01:33:32 EST A whole new report archive related interfaces and implementations are now implemented. IDocArchiveReader and IDocArchiveWriter interfaces are provided. A FileArchiveReader and FileArchiveWriter class now implements the two interfaces respectively. FileArchiveWriter and FileArchiveReader provides a single (compound) file based implementation for the report archive. The reader is able to hand out multiple streams with random access functionality (hence avoided the problem that zip entry can not be randomly accessed). The reader allows read simultaneously from multiple file pointers, i.e., all the streams are read from the same file, not different files in a folder. At the stream level, we defined RAInputStream and RAOutputstream, which derives from InputStream and OutputStream. Here RA means random access, so you can call seek directly. To use the new interfaces, caller no longer need to get a File and then create an input stream; instead, the stream is directly given to the caller. This is to provide an abstraction so that the caller won't care the low level implementations.  Based on the new report archive, the report document implementation is also updated. And report engine (api, api/impl, data, executor, presentation), DtE and viewer code are changed accordingly too.  [reply] Comment 2 Xiang Li 2005-12-23 01:04:23 EST Verified (20051222)  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: The ease of plugin deployment in BIRT development environment doesn't finished yet
description: The ease of plugin deployment in BIRT development environment doesn't finished yet [reply] Description Sue Lee 2005-11-21 22:05:34 EST The ease of plugin deployment in BIRT development environment doesn't finished yet.  [reply] Comment 1 Wei Yan 2005-11-21 23:36:19 EST assign to kshen as Sue's request.  [reply] Comment 2 Kai Shen 2005-11-22 00:58:56 EST Before the fix, when viewer is running in the embedded Tomcat in BIRT Designer, server platform is used to get plugin information, build extension registry and load classes. In order for server platform to parse plugin, a BIRT_HOME (i.e. where the plugins are located) needs to be provided. Currently, the BIRT_HOME is set to the viewer's plugins folder. That's why the latest version of the plugins must be put under viewer's plugins folder.  In order not to copy plugins into viewer's plugin folder, we need to get plugin information and load classes from Eclipse workspace instead of an arbitrary disk location like BIRT_HOME. Since server platform can not do it, the Eclipse platform needs to be used. Eclipse platform is able to get all the plugin information and load the classes from workspace because through project configuration, Eclipse platform is aware of all the external plugins (i.e. plugins under Eclipse's plugin folder) as well as the workspace plugins (i.e. plugins included in the current workspace).  To use Eclipse platform when viewer is running in the embedded Tomcat in BIRT Designer, we can simply remove all the BIRT related jar files from viewer\birt\web-inf\lib folder. To understand why it works, we need to look at the classloading of the embedded viewer first. The embedded viewer is running in Tomcat, hence a class is loaded by Tomcat classloader first. If a class can not be loaded by Tomcat, the Eclipse's PluginClassloaderWrapper will be used which will load viewer and its dependency plugin from Eclipse workspace. When the birt related jar files are removed from web-inf\lib folder, the Tomcat classloader can not load birt.core, and the PluginClassloaderWrapper is used. Since birt.core was loaded already when the Designer started and the Eclipse platform (instead of server platform) was used, Eclipse's PluginClassloaderWrapper simply return the Eclipse platform. With this Eclipse platform, all the BIRT plugins/classes are loaded from the workspace instead of the viewer's plugin folder. So, the solution is to removing the birt related JAR files from the web-inf/lib folder in the embedded viewer.  This checkin changed the build script as follows.  It implemented the new build viewer script which only builds viewer itself. This new build script will be used for the embedded viewer. It also changed the original build viewer to build web viewer which copies birt related Jar file to lib folder and plugins to plugins folder (the same behavior as before). This script will be used to build the WAR file for viewer.  [reply] Comment 3 Sue Lee 2005-11-24 02:08:19 EST Verified in daily build 20051124. Finished.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

[reply] Comment 1 Neeraj Agrawal 2005-12-05 10:23:43 EST The import of connector has been fixed for RC2. For the utility project creation please follow 116495  [reply] Comment 2 Arthur Ryman 2005-12-05 11:40:19 EST Added to Hit List at the request of Harold Gartner. I've increased the priority to P2 in case you reopen.  [reply] Comment 3 Harold Gartner 2005-12-12 14:29:43 EST This bug is not entirely fixed in RC2.  In the original text:  "One more thing which is not working (although it may once the above is corrected), is that only j2ee.jar, and not all the jars in the 'lib' directory of the WebSphere installation, is the only jar file added to the build path of the server runtime container.  I would expect all the jar files to be there."  All of the jar file in the lib directory need to be set on the container's classpath.  Otherwise the code we generate won't compile as is references classes outside of j2ee.jar.  Creating a basic J2EE runtime library adds all of the jars in the specified directory to the container classpath.  I would assume that targetting a Webshpere server should be doing exactly the same thing. Since the original blocking bug has been fixed and we do not plan to fix the remaining problem in 1.0, it is being deferred. The workaround for now is to manually add the required jars to the classpath.  [reply] Comment 7 Arthur Ryman 2006-01-12 20:20:16 EST Sinan, can you fix this in 1.0.1? Thx. The engine used to return a null IRowSet if there was no row before, I believe it should not throw an exception in any case when we try to evaluate the expression. Reassigning to data team.  [reply] Comment 2 jluo 2005-12-27 20:00:35 EST IRowSet is provided by Engine team.  [reply] Comment 3 David Michonneau 2005-12-28 05:44:17 EST Reassigning to engine team. Some suggestions from Zhiqiang:  Current IDataRowExpressionEvaluator.first() doesn¨t have a return value. This causes a bug in DataProcessor when binding the data. The code is in mapToChartResultSet():    idre.first( );    do  {  oaTuple = new Object[iColumnCount];  it = co.iterator( );  iColumnIndex = 0;  while ( it.hasNext( ) )  {  oaTuple[iColumnIndex++] = idre.evaluate( (String) it.next( ) );  }  liResultSet.add( oaTuple );  } while ( idre.next( ) );    So with this, even the IRowSet doesn¨t have any row, the chart ResultSet will have one null row, this is not correct.    I think we should change it to Boolean first(); And also you can see in java.sql.ResultSet, the first() method has a return value to indicate if current cursor is in a valid position.    And after we change the interface. This code will be:    boolean hasFirst = idre.first( );    if ( hasFirst )  {  do  {  oaTuple = new Object[iColumnCount];  it = co.iterator( );  iColumnIndex = 0;  while ( it.hasNext( ) )  {  oaTuple[iColumnIndex++] = idre.evaluate( (String) it.next( ) );  }  liResultSet.add( oaTuple );  } while ( idre.next( ) );  }    Now it will be correct for this case.    This change will involve all the IDataRowExpressionEvaluator implementation, including SqlDataRowEvaluator, BirtDataRowEvaluator, and one anonymous implementation in ChartUIUtil.  [reply] Comment 4 Zhiqiang Qian 2005-12-28 21:55:40 EST Fixed. Changed IDataRowExpressionEvaluation interface and implementaion, added return value for first() method. same Exception.  [reply] Comment 2 Jun Zhai 2005-12-27 16:19:20 EST Something wrong with initialization of "ScriptLib". When deploy to weblogic, the file object could be null.  [reply] Comment 3 Jun Zhai 2005-12-28 15:44:15 EST *** Bug 122231 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***  [reply] Comment 4 Kai Shen 2006-01-03 19:24:12 EST Resolution Comment: In WAR deployment, since the absolute path might not be available, user is required to set BIRT_VIEWER_SCRIPTLIB_DIR in web.xml in order to use script library JARs. This behavior is already documented. If user doesn¨t set it, the script library directory could be null. The problem is that the null pointer was not handled properly. This checkin fixed the problem.  [reply] Comment 5 Liwen Chen 2006-01-05 03:12:27 EST Verify this bug in build 20060105  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Performance: IRender is slower than IRunAndRender
description: Performance: IRender is slower than IRunAndRender [reply] Description Xiang Li 2005-12-31 02:19:49 EST It happened in BIRT 2.0 nightly build 20051226.  I deployed the BIRT viewers on Tomcat 4.1. The OS were Windows 2003 and RedHat Linux 4.0 AS. I had automatic tools that continuously submitted 1) URL request to generate reports from rptdesigns; 2) SOAP request to retrieve reports from rptdocuments. Reports are different in terms of number of pages and number of rows on each page. The machine had 4GB physical memory and the jvm max. heap size was 256MB. summary: Performance enhancement for RandomAccessFile
description: Performance enhancement for RandomAccessFile [reply] Description Stanley Wang 2006-01-04 15:24:35 EST The readInt method for RandomAccessFile makes 4 calls to system, and the calls are not buffered.  [reply] Comment 1 Kai Shen 2006-01-04 20:14:17 EST The readInt method of RandomAccessFile makes 4 calls to system, and the calls are not buffered. Since report archive is based on RandomAccessFile and function readInt is called very frequently (for each object) while reading the report document, we added a buffer to reduce the system IO calls from 4 to 1. Unit tests show the performance for function readInt() is now 3.5 times faster than before.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Websphere on Linux semicolons in Classpath
description: Websphere on Linux semicolons in Classpath [reply] Description Bob Herrmann 2006-01-13 23:27:19 EST Trying to start Websphere on Linux (yes, using the IBM JDK - and there should be a warning if you try to use any other JDK with Websphere) generates a bunch of vmarguments for invoking the startup of Websphere.  Unfortunately eclipse generates semi-colons on Linux, and not colons, which seems to muck up classpath.  [reply] Comment 1 Naci Dai 2006-01-15 02:21:10 EST Assigned to sinan  [reply] Comment 2 Sinan Konya 2006-01-16 04:32:37 EST "pathChar" property was added into org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver for OS dependent pathSeparator. And this ${pathChar} was used in websphere.6.serverdef as a path separator.  [reply] Comment 3 David Williams 2006-03-04 01:04:35 EST This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).   [reply] Comment 4 David Williams 2006-09-22 20:46:48 EDT This bug is being moved to the "closed" state since because it has been in the fixed state for a long time it is being assumed fixed without explicit verification from the originator. If there is still a problem, in the most recent 1.5.x builds, please reopen or open another bug.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: server.getLaunchConfiguration returns null
description: server.getLaunchConfiguration returns null [reply] Description Sachin Patel 2006-01-16 17:22:34 EST In the following scenario server.getLaunchConfiguration returns null even if "true" is passed in for the create parameter.  I have an server editor sections that calls getLaunchConfiguration.  If I...  (1) Define a geronimo server (2) Open the server editor (3) Shutdown the workbench (keeping the editor open) (4) Restart the workbench  At which point the server editor fails to create due to a failure in my section since it cannot create an instanceof the launchConfiguration.  Then If you close the editor and re-open it then the editor appears succesfully, it only fails on workbench restart if the editor is left open on the previous session.  [reply] Comment 1 Tim deBoer 2006-01-16 21:42:10 EST I couldn't reproduce on 1.0.1 after trying several times and using a few of the different servers in WTP. I'll try again shortly on a 1.5 build, but let me know if you track it down any further in the meantime.  [reply] Comment 2 Sachin Patel 2006-01-16 21:58:17 EST It only happens if a server editor section is added that has code that calls getLaunchConfiguration.  I was able to produce it on a 1.0 driver, let me move up to 1.0.1 and see if it happens to resolved.  [reply] Comment 3 Sachin Patel 2006-01-17 09:40:19 EST Yes this happens on 1.0.1 as well.  If you want you can reproduce on Geronimo by installing the geronimo server adapter from here.  http://cvs.apache.org/dist/geronimo/eclipse/unstable/  (1) Define a geronimo server. (2) Open its editor (3) Shutdown workbench (4) Restart workbench (5) The open editor has an error. You have to close the editor and reopen it for it to open succusfully.  If you put a breakpoint in SetConsoleLogLevelCommand.getLaunchConfiguration() you will see that on workbench startup it returns null even though "create" is set to true.  I don't understand the code for getLaunchConfiguration so I'm not sure whats causing it exacly.  [reply] Comment 4 Tim deBoer 2006-01-18 10:44:49 EST Found the problem. The workaround for bug 91333 was failing in this case because the platform does an undocumented suspend/resume of the Job queue during UI startup, and Job.join() has a failure in that it silently does not join() if the Job queue is suspended.  Removed workaround for 91333, which appears to have been fixed by the platform team. That fixes this bug, so I'll check it in.  [reply] Comment 5 Tim deBoer 2006-01-18 19:16:16 EST Fix released for next 1.0.1 M-build.  [reply] Comment 6 Sachin Patel 2006-01-23 09:34:51 EST The problem still occurs on last thursday's 1.0.1 I-build  [reply] Comment 7 Sachin Patel 2006-01-25 12:41:39 EST Re tested this on latest 1.0.1 driver and confirmed that it is fixed. Thanks Tim!  [reply] Comment 8 Tim deBoer 2006-01-25 12:56:06 EST Hmmm... I haven't changed any code since last week. Maybe there was some kind of build problem and the code didn't update? Anyways, glad to hear it is fixed. Please let me know if you run into any more problems with this.  [reply] Comment 9 Eclipse Webmaster 2007-07-29 09:18:48 EDT Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Regression in latest M-Build
description: Regression in latest M-Build [reply] Description Sachin Patel 2006-01-25 14:25:29 EST After moving up to this M-build, a regression has appeared.  When creating a project, the target runtime does not apply.  The project shows an emtpy server classpath container. When checking the defined runtimes in preferences, the runtime is defined, however, its "location" is being lost.  This is only happens on the Geronimo Runtime.  My initial thought was that something was broken I changed, however, when simply backleveling my target to a previous I-driver, the problem did not occur.  [reply] Comment 1 Sachin Patel 2006-01-25 14:34:22 EST Keep in mind I am no longer using the generic wizard fragment and I have reused some of the behavior in the ServerTypeDefinitionRuntimeDecorator to set the app server location.  It may be that the generic implementation changed to save the runtime and I need to react as well.  [reply] Comment 2 Sachin Patel 2006-01-25 14:35:47 EST Created attachment 33614 [details] Geronimo implementation of runtime wizard fragment  Adding attachment to see if you stop anything immediatly.  [reply] Comment 3 Sachin Patel 2006-01-25 14:53:04 EST After stepping through when creating the target runtime, the following call I making seems to set the property map.  getRuntimeDelegate().setServerInstanceProperties(getValues());  Stepping over on the validate before the wizard finishes, I inspect getRuntimeDelegate() and it does contain the map with the serverLocation value.  The behavior is the same on both the working and broken driver.  I don't think its my code.  [reply] Comment 4 Tim deBoer 2006-01-25 15:46:59 EST Fix checked into CVS. I very carefully made an API change, deprecated old methods, ... and missed delegating some of the old methods to the new methods.  [reply] Comment 5 Sachin Patel 2006-01-26 10:27:49 EST What do i need to pull this fix in?  I didn't see a 1.0.1 branch in CVS so I checked out wst.server.core and jst.server.core from HEAD, but that didn't seem to pull in the fix.  [reply] Comment 6 Tim deBoer 2006-01-26 14:00:32 EST Fix dropped to HEAD and tagged for next M-build.  [reply] Comment 7 Sachin Patel 2006-01-26 14:42:36 EST The location not showing up in preferences was a problem on my end which I fixed.  The problem of the runtime jars not applying to a project still exists after your fix.  I verified the problem occurs on Jonas as well. Will comment on 125032.  [reply] Comment 8 Sachin Patel 2006-01-27 22:11:53 EST Fixed in HEAD  [reply] Comment 9 David Williams 2006-09-25 02:57:04 EDT This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old its assumed fixed and no longer useful or need further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error.  [reply] Comment 10 Eclipse Webmaster 2007-07-29 09:18:52 EDT Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Design file compatibility test (phase 1)
description: Design file compatibility test (phase 1) [reply] Description Rock Yu 2006-03-08 21:58:07 EST BIRT Designer should be able to open and layout reports files written use previous BIRT releases. We should test the current release against design files generated with major releases as: R1.0.0, R1.0.1, R2.0.0, and R2.0.1.  The test files can be chosen from previous acceptance or smoke test cases, and we will improve the coverage gradually.  Prepare a bunch of design files that are created with the major releases categorized by their version. Here are several tips and rules:  1) For an old design file say report_v1.0.0.rptdesign, open it with some latest Designer R1.0.1, do some minor change, then save it. The design structure will be automatically upgraded into R1.0.1 version. So the new file saved as report_v1.0.1 can be save as test file for R1.0.1  2) Choose the test file with care. Once a design file is choosen as compatibility test file, it will be tested throughout the production lifecycle, and never changed again. A build should pass all the compatibility test before it can be released.  3) Try to cover most of the new features that were added in the latter release. For example, add design with styles into R1.0.0 and design with Theme into R2.0.0.  4) It's okay and sometimes recommended that the test design files have some semantic warnings. Designer will allow reports with warnings but refuse to open reports with errors. So for test purpose, we should try design files with some warnings to make ensure that designer will always tolerate a warning.  [reply] Comment 1 Rock Yu 2006-03-16 00:36:54 EST Shasha:  Compatibility test should also include the sample reports that we publish with BIRT. The files are listed under http://www.eclipse.org/birt/phoenix/examples/  Please cover all the sample files.  [reply] Comment 2 shasha hu 2006-03-28 21:02:45 EST Added.  [reply] Comment 3 Rock Yu 2006-04-09 23:42:02 EDT Verified 04/10/2006  [reply] Comment 4 Rock Yu 2006-07-25 02:26:50 EDT closed  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Support FolderArchive in BIRT.core
description: Support FolderArchive in BIRT.core [reply] Description Stanley Wang 2006-03-24 12:52:35 EST BIRT curently supports FolderArchive reader and writer. However, to support using report document as data source, and potentially even replace the report document during rendering, an interface/class that supports both read and write with the same object is needed.  Because BIRT internal codes uses archive reader and writer frequently, it is desirable that the new class implements both the reader and writer interfaces. The implementation class could contain a reader and a writer class, and implement the two interfaces through delagation. But this is not a requirement, but just a suggestion.  The interface shuld also support a method isOpen() for checking whether the archive is already open.  The interface should support file lock, i.e., read/write file lock.  The class for now does not need to support synchronization between read/write. It is the caller's responsibility to do so, using the lock mechanism/method on the archive.  Because the archive is a folder, concurrently read/write is an exception, instead of norm.  [reply] Comment 1 Kai Shen 2006-03-29 13:55:11 EST Resolution Comment: A FolderArchive class that supports both read and write within the same object was implemented and added into birt.core. The locking mechanism is not needed, nor is it implemented. (The reporter has agreed on it.)  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: NPE on PackageAdminImpl.setResolved
description: NPE on PackageAdminImpl.setResolved [reply] Description Sachin Patel 2006-03-27 10:44:47 EST I am invoking eclipse headless applications multiple times within a maven build environment.  In 3.1.2 defect 107909 prevented me from shutting down the workbench after each invocation, and the workaroud was for me to set the noShutdown property to true.  (However even though this worked there were issues later on).  So with 107909 fixed I moved up to the 3.2.0 M5 build.  The first invocation to the headless application works fine, then immediatley during the build the headless app is invoked again but on the second call it fails with the following exception:  java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdminImpl.setResolved(PackageAdminImpl.java:282) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdminImpl.applyDeltas(PackageAdminImpl.java:297) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdminImpl.processDelta(PackageAdminImpl.java:370) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdminImpl.doResolveBundles(PackageAdminImpl.java:191) at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdminImpl$1.run(PackageAdminImpl.java:139) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:552)  [reply] Comment 1 Thomas Watson 2006-03-27 11:38:40 EST Can you provide us steps to reproduce.  From the stacktrace it seems the state thinks there is a resolved host bundle for a fragment but the actual Bundle object for the host cannot be found in the framework.  This should not be possible.  Are you manipulating the system state of the framework somehow?  [reply] Comment 2 Sachin Patel 2006-03-27 12:44:57 EST My current workaround for 3.1.2 was to set PROP_NOSHUTDOWN to true and call EclipseStarter.run(args, null) on the first invocation and then EclipseStarter.run(args) there after.  In 3.1.2 between calls I was able to call different applications by setting the system property eclipse.application.  In 3.2 this is no longer, as if I go back to using the workaround its always calling the same application and my scenario calls for calling different applications.  (Not sure if this is the intent or if this is a bug). So for 3.2 I am currently broken as I cannot startup the workbench multiple times within Maven due to the exception below nor can I use the workaround to keep the platform alive.  [reply] Comment 3 Sachin Patel 2006-03-27 14:06:05 EST I don't think I'm modifying the state. This is happening in the context of Maven, so let me see if I can extract the code out into a standalone java app as a test case and see if the problem occurs.  [reply] Comment 4 Sachin Patel 2006-03-28 10:55:52 EST Created attachment 37089 [details] TestCase showing exception  Attached is the test case showing the NPE exception.  You can import the contents of the zip as a project in your workspace and launch it as a java app.  You will need to modify the ECIPSE_HOME var to point to Eclipse 3.2 M5 + WTP 1.0.1.  Also change WORKSPACE to your preference.  The test case shows the the first invocation to run() works fine as the usage is printed out for the given application.  Then immediately run() is invoked again but this time fails with the NPE. This mimics the behavior of how the code is invoked within the maven context.  [reply] Comment 5 Thomas Watson 2006-03-28 12:19:57 EST Thanks for the testcase.  This will greatly help us in solving the problem.  I want to confirm that you are using the same EclipseStarter class to relaunch the Equinox framework in maven.  As a workaround you may consider creating a new URLClassLoader for each launch of equinox.  With that said I'm not satisfied with the workaround and we should look to solve this problem in 3.2.  [reply] Comment 6 Sachin Patel 2006-03-28 12:24:36 EST Thanks.  Yes I am using the EclipseStarter each time.  How do I go about creating a new URLClassLoader for each launch? Is there a snippit of code that you could provide?  [reply] Comment 7 Thomas Watson 2006-03-28 12:46:29 EST The project equinox-incubator/org.eclipse.equinox.servlet.bridge.launcher has a class FrameworkLauncher that creates a new URLClassLoader for the purpose of launching multiple frameworks in the same VM.  You should take a look at that example to see if you can reuse some of that work.  [reply] Comment 8 Thomas Watson 2006-03-28 13:12:36 EST The root of the problem is in a static initializer from the Class BaseStorage  private static final BaseStorage INSTANCE = new BaseStorage();  We need to make sure a new instance of BaseStorage is used for each instance of the framework.  I hope to get a patch ready in time for M6.  [reply] Comment 9 Thomas Watson 2006-03-28 15:11:18 EST Created attachment 37133 [details] patch  This patch gets rid of the ugly static initializer in BaseStorage.  Instead the BaseStorageHook is responsible for constructing the instance of BaseStorage to be used by the framework instance.  [reply] Comment 10 Thomas Watson 2006-03-28 15:12:15 EST Pascal/DJ please review patch for M6.  [reply] Comment 11 Jeff McAffer 2006-03-28 15:37:28 EST +1  [reply] Comment 12 Sachin Patel 2006-03-28 16:36:28 EST Thanks! I verified the patch and it resolves the issue.  I am running into another issue though regarding if a second invocation lauches a different application, the application from the previous launch runs, rather then the new one.  Currently I'm just setting the system property for the application id, but let me pass the property via setInitialProperties() instead as well as using a different URLClassLoader as you suggested to see if this resolves it before I open a issue on this.  [reply] Comment 13 Thomas Watson 2006-03-28 18:54:12 EST Released patch for M6.  I'm not sure I understand why the previous app is being launched instead of the next one when you launch a second framework.  It would be interesting to investigate this issue (in another bug report of coarse ;-)  [reply] Comment 14 Sachin Patel 2006-03-29 10:54:48 EST Sorry :( I'm going to have to re-open this.  The patch fixes the stand-alone test case, but the NPE still occurs when running within Maven.  I don't know why... the launch code is the same.  One difference is that Maven is putting the org.eclipse.osgi jar in the classpath (but the location is from the maven repository) but the osgi.framework property is set to point to the osgi jar in the eclipse/plugins, even though both jars are the same do you think this would cause a problem?  [reply] Comment 15 Sachin Patel 2006-03-29 11:08:10 EST Actually I think that was the problem :) If I take out the parent classloader (maven) it works :)  [reply] Comment 16 Eclipse Webmaster 2007-07-29 09:19:20 EDT Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

Steps to reproduce: 1.Get the attached design file. 2.Open this report design in the latest build, and open the chart builder. In the "Select Data" tab, there is no data displayed in the data preview windows.  Error message: Error0 : Error.ScriptEvaluationError ( 22 time(s) ) detail : org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.EngineException: There are errors evaluating script "row["AfterPrintName"]". at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.executor.ExecutionContext.evaluate(ExecutionContext.java:520) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.executor.ExecutionContext.evaluate(ExecutionContext.java:482) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.data.dte.DteResultSet.evaluate(DteResultSet.java:275) at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.extension.internal.RowSet.evaluate(RowSet.java:107) at org.eclipse.birt.chart.reportitem.ChartReportItemGenerationImpl.onRowSets(ChartReportItemGenerationImpl.java:166)  [reply] Comment 1 Sissi Zhu 2006-04-07 03:14:18 EDT Created attachment 37971 [details] Report design  [reply] Comment 2 Yulin Wang 2006-04-07 04:10:34 EDT Suggest cancelling this bug. summary: Eclipse projects ideas for the Google Summer of Code 2006
description: Eclipse projects ideas for the Google Summer of Code 2006 [reply] Description Philippe Ombredanne 2006-04-24 17:25:54 EDT All, Eclipse is a mentor organization for the Google Summer of Code 2006. http://code.google.com/soc/  http://code.google.com/soc/eclipse/about.html  The purpose of this bug is to collect ideas for projects. Please post comments! If you submit a project, think aklso about being a mentor... Projects without mentor may not happen ;-)  To sign up for being a mentor you can visit: http://code.google.com/soc/mentor_step1.html (only for mentor, student sign-in is open only after May 1st at a different URL)  Thanks for your help.  [reply] Comment 1 Gunnar Wagenknecht 2006-04-24 17:50:23 EDT Ok. We don't have to bother the webmaster with this. :)  [reply] Comment 2 Benjamin Pasero 2006-04-28 11:48:23 EDT Here are some ideas that come to my mind:  - Implementation of System-Tray API for Mac, allowing to control the Dock (See Bug 56116)  - Embedding Editors and Views (See Bug 71125)  And here some Browser related features:  - API for the Browser to set content from a Stream. Currently you can only call setText() or open an URL.  - A way of communication from the Browser to the Java Application. It would be nice to have a method that returns the result of a Java-Script call (similiar to Browser#execute(), which currently only returns if the operation failed or not).  - DOM support for the Browser via Java-API, avoiding to directly use JavaScript  Ben  [reply] Comment 3 Philippe Ombredanne 2006-05-03 23:24:36 EDT That list is now maintained on the Eclipse wiki at: http://eclipsewiki.editme.com/GoogleSummerOfCode2006 Ben ideas have been added to that page.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: [Automation] Rewrite build files for test plugins and integrate with build
description: [Automation] Rewrite build files for test plugins and integrate with build [reply] Description Rock Yu 2006-05-10 22:44:42 EDT BIRT test framework has changed. QA's test plug-ins also need some changes.  We need to rewrite the build scripts for each test plug-ins. Here is the requirements:  1. Public targets Each build file should define the several public targets:  a) UnitTest b) APIJavadoc c) Clean d) Report  2. Private targets Follow the names:  e) compileTest (depend on f) ) f) buildDependents g) utest (for develop usage, depend on b),c),d) )  3. Integration Work with build team, integrate the test with daily build, we should be able to see the log and test result from our build page.  4. Misc 1) Move reusable logic or script code into our "org.eclipse.birt.tests.core" plugin 2) The caller(daily build) should be able to redirect all the outputs like logs, reports etc. These path should be defined as variables.  [reply] Comment 1 Xiang Li 2006-05-28 03:41:17 EDT added build.xml for tests.model and tests.engine. unable to do it for tests.data, as it is lack of maintenance. please log a bug for that.  [reply] Comment 2 Rock Yu 2006-06-15 01:27:43 EDT Verified.  [reply] Comment 3 Rock Yu 2006-07-25 02:23:52 EDT closed  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: hiding & displaying grids
description: hiding & displaying grids [reply] Description Masibonge 2006-05-17 06:42:50 EDT I'm trying to hide part of my output based on boolean flag. My report data is structured through the use of grids. So if a certain condition is true; I must hide a specific grid, if it is false, then something else must be hidden. Can u assist please????????  [reply] Comment 1 Ivy Li 2006-05-19 03:43:01 EDT can you help?  [reply] Comment 2 Wenbin He 2006-05-23 14:54:26 EDT I don't think that BIRT support conditional format for grid. But I think you can control the content to hide/show inside grid cells.  [reply] Comment 3 Wenfeng Li 2006-05-30 21:25:03 EDT You can wirte a script in a report item's onCreate() method to set/unset the visibility of a grid report item.  Similar script can also be written for report item that is inside a grid to hide the report item in that grid cell.   [reply] Comment 4 Sissi Zhu 2007-05-30 02:28:17 EDT You can edit script for grid, see the following steps. 1.Pull a grid to the layout, insert a label to the grid. Select the grid, and switch to the "Script" tab in the designer. 2. Edit script for onCreate function. For example: this.getStyle().visibleFormat="pdf"; (This code will set invisible on pdf output.) this.getStyle().backgroundColor="red"; (This code will set background color on the grid.)  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Remove call to "_debuggerService.setInitAtStartup(true)"
description: Remove call to "_debuggerService.setInitAtStartup(true)" [reply] Description Javier Pedemonte 2006-05-23 15:44:37 EDT I don't think the call to _debuggerService.setInitAtStartup(true) is necessary.  We currently use the following hack to startup up the JSD service: // debuggerService.on(); // will crash. can only be called from JS // do this instead: String jsdObserverCID = "2fd6b7f6-eb8c-4f32-ad26-113f2c02d0fe"; nsIObserver jsdObserver = (nsIObserver) Mozilla.getInstance() .getComponentManager().createInstance(jsdObserverCID, null, nsIObserver.NS_IOBSERVER_IID); jsdObserver.observe(null, "", "");  This is basically what setInitAtStartup() does under the covers, but this hack is more direct.  Adam, just want to make sure this is OK with you.  [reply] Comment 1 Javier Pedemonte 2006-05-23 15:47:18 EDT Created attachment 42308 [details] patch  [reply] Comment 2 Javier Pedemonte 2006-05-24 18:15:49 EDT Patch checked in.  -> FIXED  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Install is not consistent with other Eclipse projects
description: Install is not consistent with other Eclipse projects [reply] Description Lawrence Mandel 2006-06-07 16:16:34 EDT ATF currently requires that users download the Dojo and Rico libraries and add them to the respective personality plug-ins (in the resources folder). When installing ATF 0.1 this was difficult because the personality plug-ins and jarred. To install these libraries a user either needs to add them to the jar or extract the jar.  I expected that these personality plug-ins would be expanded as folders in the plug-ins directory.  [reply] Comment 1 Lawrence Mandel 2006-06-07 16:44:25 EDT Turns out I didn't follow the directions correctly. I simply downloaded and unzipped into the eclipse directory instead of treating the download as a local update site. I did this because this is the way other Eclipse project downloads are used. I've updated the summary of this bug to reflect this. I think the downloads from the ATF project should be simply unzipped into the install directory as is Eclipse convention.  [reply] Comment 2 Gino Bustelo 2006-06-07 17:15:26 EDT We use the Archived Site approach because we need to bring in other dependencies that are hosted elsewhere (not in Eclipse.org). We are leveraging Eclipse Update/Install system for this to try to make the install almost a one step thing (as far as licensing allows).  We will look into how much effort it would be to do a simple unzip install (in terms of the user).  Good point... I agree that this is how most of the Eclipse projects do it.  [reply] Comment 3 Bill Higgins 2006-06-28 09:34:24 EDT Naive question: is it possible to work out agreements with the other organizations so that their components *can* be hosted on eclipse.org as part of the Eclipse install?  I personally prefer to download components like ATF into some folder and  link it into my Eclipse install via a .link file rather than update manager.  [reply] Comment 4 ccocchiaro@nexaweb.com 2006-09-21 14:12:21 EDT This is actually quite a problem since we use an automated ant build to create an InstallAnywhere executable for our product and it needs to install ATF (and the associated runtime files) once it's  extracted Eclipse and WTP into the users' install location.  The only way we can currently install ATF is by extracting the files from the ATF zip/gz/tar file into the Eclipse installation directories.  We either need a way to install it from InstallAnywhere using this Archive Site mechanism or we need a zip that includes all the files (external ones as well) so that we can extract them from our install executable.  I don't know of any other way to distribute ATF with our product.  [reply] Comment 5 Robert Goodman 2006-09-21 21:49:17 EDT We don't have a short-term solution to this problem. The process for getting approval to put third party software on eclipse is very long. We first have to get PMC approval to submit the paper work to begin the legal review by eclipse. We have done this. Then the third party software has to go through a legal review from the eclipse lawyers. Eclipse has limited legal resources, so these reviews can take time. After it is reviewed and approved by the lawyers, it has to be submitted to the eclipse board for approval. I think the Eclipse board meets 4 times a year. If we decide to go up to a new version of a third party package, we have to go through another a legal review and then submit it to the board for approval. In the time we first put ATF on eclipse, we have moved up to a new version of Dojo, Rico, Prototype, and JSLint. We are in looking at  moving up to a new version of XPCom and Zimbra. It looks like the eclipse legal process would be a big hindrance. We are in the discussion with the eclipse legal team to see if there is a way to short circuit the process.  We are studying other possible solutions to the problem. Such as preference wizards that would allow a developer to specifying a location of the runtime instead of just having to copy it into the plugin. An example would be WTP support for Tomcat. We would still use Update Manger because some of the third party like XPCom, Rhino would still be on other sites. At this point my guess is that we will come up with some other solution than packaging the third party software in the zip file.  ATF is open source you can download the source and build your own package with the third party software included.  [reply] Comment 6 ccocchiaro@nexaweb.com 2006-09-22 07:22:42 EDT Please let me know if the following strategy would work or not as a short-term resolution to this issue:  1. Install Eclipse 3.2/WTP 1.5.0 using all-in-one zip 2. Run Eclipse and install ATF manually using Archive Site mechanism 3. Manually copy additional ATF runtime files into Eclipse directory structure using AT installation instructions 4. Create new zip file using the final Eclipse directory structure 5. Unzip new zip file automatically using InstallAnywhere executable  I'm not sure if anything else happens during ATF install related to Windows Registry, etc... so that's why I'm inquiring as to whether this will work or not.  Thanks!  [reply] Comment 7 Lawrence Mandel 2006-09-22 09:17:09 EDT As an alternative to bundling the AJAX frameworks with Eclipse (if you haven't already investigated this), how about working with the AJAX projects to create update sites at the projects? For example, Dojo can host an update site that Eclipse users can use to install Dojo into ATF. This means less legal approval from Eclipse and offloading the management of Dojo updates to Dojo. This approach is similar to the approach WTP has taken with server adapters because we cannot maintain all the requested server adapters.  [reply] Comment 8 Robert Goodman 2006-09-22 11:29:58 EDT You should be able to make you proposed steps to build a zip file to work. I have zipped up an eclipse install before and moved it to a new machine. As far as I know eclipse doesn't use the registry, but it does have a configuration directory <eclipse_install_dir>/configuration. You should probably look in that directory to see if there is any that will cause problems. Make sure you start eclipse with "eclipse -clean" before creating the zip file.  We have try to get  the AJAX runtimes projects to put the plugins on there sites. That is why Zimbra plugin is out the Zimbra site, but most of the vendors weren't interested.  [reply] Comment 9 Philippe Ombredanne 2007-10-09 21:22:52 EDT The latest builds of ATF do not include personalities anymore for better or worse. And the xulrunners are shipped with it. I think this bug is no longer relevant. Closing.  [reply] Comment 10 Lawrence Mandel 2007-10-09 23:37:29 EDT Philippe, how about my comments in comment #1? Does the ATF install still require extracting to a local location and using that location as an update site instead of simply unzipping into the eclipse dir?  [reply] Comment 11 Robert Goodman 2007-10-10 10:34:55 EDT ATF now provides all-in-ones and versions that can be unzipped on top of an existing eclipse installs. ATF also has preference pages for configuring Ajax runtimes which means copying of the runtimes are no longer required.  [reply] Comment 12 Lawrence Mandel 2007-10-10 10:47:06 EDT Thanks Bob. I'm satisfied. I'm marking this as verified.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: PM - Guideline: Staffing Project - add content
description: PM - Guideline: Staffing Project - add content [reply] Description Chris Armstrong 2006-06-11 19:59:55 EDT   [reply] Comment 1 Per Kroll 2006-08-30 17:11:33 EDT Descoped per recent discussion.  [reply] Comment 2 Ricardo Balduino 2006-10-19 13:37:59 EDT As per discussion in http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/epf-dev/msg01246.html, we are changing the Version number to 0.9. That's the version against what the Bugzilla issue was filed. Target Milestone is 1.0, which is the expected version of OpenUP/Basic when we will release the fix to the issue. Later, as iterations are planned, we assign the individual issues to 1.0 M1, 1.0 M2 and so on. For now, we are keeping bugs assigned to "Content" component, but it may be moved to "OpenUP" component (waiting response from Eclipse webmaster on how to create that component).  And sorry if these changes create an avalanche of emails :-)  Cheers,  Ricardo.  [reply] Comment 3 Per Kroll 2006-11-30 17:04:04 EST Let's leverage content form Scott's "generalizing specialist".  [reply] Comment 4 Per Kroll 2006-11-30 17:08:31 EST Scott, can you please take care of this at some stage. Use Target Milestone attribute to assign it to an iteration once you know when you can handle it.  [reply] Comment 5 Scott Ambler 2006-11-30 22:26:14 EST I'm on it.  Assigned it to 1.0 M3, assuming that meant iteration I3.  If that's not the case, could someone please update this appropriately for me?  Thanks.  [reply] Comment 6 Scott Ambler 2006-12-31 16:53:48 EST Changes: 1. Added a PM guideline called "Staffing a Project". 2. Added a link to it from the PM task "Plan the Project"  [reply] Comment 7 Brian G. Lyons 2007-01-10 11:29:32 EST We should review this in the next iteration and Close it.  [reply] Comment 8 Brian G. Lyons 2007-02-01 17:47:21 EST Fixed a typo.  This must have been cut and pasted from some Microsoft product -- there were all sorts of nasty MsNormal font setup items and weird spacing.  I cleaned all that up.  I also tweaked the wording so that -- to be more consistent with the rest of OpenUP -- there was less talk of "you" should do this with "your team".  It is not a particularly "wrong" style or anything, but it felt different than most of the other content.  I tacked on one sentence to the Main Description.  It kind of ended with "you might not be able to do all of this...".  I tacked on something along the lines of "partial adherence to this guideline will add value if you can't do it all".  We should discuss one additional thing I did.  I didn't like having a link out to the Ambysoft page in the middle of the text.  We have links to other OpenUP elements all over the place and linking white papers in this way rubbed me wrong.  Perhaps we should add a proper reference in the references and have a link to that.  I am closing this bug.  If someone has heartburn on my updates, feel free to re-open the bug and re-open the discussion.  Changes have been committed to CVS.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: XPCOMException when terminating an app when stopped on an exception break
description: XPCOMException when terminating an app when stopped on an exception break [reply] Description Robert Goodman 2006-07-06 21:36:30 EDT XPCOMException when terminating an app when stopped on an exception break  Set the option to suspend on an exception. In your JavaScript file cause an exception by adding throw "message"; statement. When the program suspends on the exception, press the red terminate button in the debug view and the following exception is thrown.  org.mozilla.xpcom.XPCOMException: The function "removeObserver" returned an error condition  (0x80004005) at org.mozilla.xpcom.internal.XPCOMJavaProxy.callXPCOMMethod(Native Method) at org.mozilla.xpcom.internal.XPCOMJavaProxy.invoke(XPCOMJavaProxy.java:140) at $Proxy36.removeObserver(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.atf.mozilla.ide.ui.xhrmon.XHRObserver.stopObserving(XHRObserver.java:71) at org.eclipse.atf.mozilla.ide.ui.xhrmon.XHRMonitorView.doDestroyPage(XHRMonitorView.java:86) at org.eclipse.ui.part.PageBookView.removePage(PageBookView.java:854) at org.eclipse.ui.part.PageBookView.dispose(PageBookView.java:506) at org.eclipse.atf.mozilla.ide.ui.xhrmon.XHRMonitorView.dispose(XHRMonitorView.java:113)  If the application is terminated by closing the browser the follow exception is thrown  org.mozilla.xpcom.XPCOMException: The function "jsClassName" returned an error condition  (0x80040111) at org.mozilla.xpcom.internal.XPCOMJavaProxy.callXPCOMMethod(Native Method) at org.mozilla.xpcom.internal.XPCOMJavaProxy.invoke(XPCOMJavaProxy.java:140) at $Proxy37.getJsClassName(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)  [reply] Comment 1 Robert Goodman 2006-07-06 21:37:20 EDT Created attachment 45900 [details] Here is my test script where I'm getting the error  [reply] Comment 2 Javier Pedemonte 2006-07-07 14:37:33 EDT Created attachment 45947 [details] JSDebugThread patch  This patch fixes the "jsClassName" exception (and a similar exception with "setScriptsEnabled").  Problem was that some of the methods in JSDebugThread are callbacks on a separate thread, but they can get called after the debugger has terminated.  For these two methods, I added a check to JSDebugTarget.isTerminated().  Are most of the methods in this class callbacks?  Should all of them have this check?  [reply] Comment 3 Javier Pedemonte 2006-07-07 18:10:49 EDT Created attachment 45975 [details] JSDebugTarget patch  OK, I think I found out the real fix for this.  When JSDebugTarget.terminate() is called, it first calls shutdown(), then goes through each JSDebugThread and terminates them.  However, shutdown() was setting the _threads array to zero length first, so none of the threads were ever getting terminated.  This had the effect that the Eclipse debugger framework would later call in to some of these JSDebugThreads, thinking they were still active.  Now, with this fix, the debugger framework sees that the threads are terminated, and doesn't call into them.  This also seems to fix another issue that Bob was seeing, where under certain instances, the debugger wouldn't stop on breakpoints.  Bob, try out this patch and see if it works for you.  The method JSDebugThread.disconnect() is similar to terminate(), but the call to JSDebugThread.terminate() is commented out, with a TODO.  Adam, is this your change?  Should that be uncommented?  I'm not sure if this fixes the "removeObserver" exception, since I haven't been able to recreate.  [reply] Comment 4 Robert Goodman 2006-07-10 10:23:55 EDT The patch fixes problem of the debugger not stopping on braekpoint when you click on a process to terminate the application. It doesn't fix the problem when you click on the thread to terminate the application. This seems to be a cause by the method handleDebugEvents in JSDebugTarget. It is also clearing the threads before calling terminate.  [reply] Comment 5 Robert Goodman 2006-07-10 14:20:41 EDT Comment on attachment 45975 [details] JSDebugTarget patch  will submit new patch  [reply] Comment 6 Robert Goodman 2006-07-10 14:21:39 EDT Created attachment 46028 [details] Patch for main truck  [reply] Comment 7 Robert Goodman 2006-07-10 14:22:37 EDT Created attachment 46029 [details] Patch for branch WTP1_RC6.txt  [reply] Comment 8 Javier Pedemonte 2006-07-10 15:00:15 EDT Checked in to HEAD and wtp1_5RC6 branch.  ->FIXED  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Optimization: Reference Use and URL Caching in ClassLoader Repository
description: Optimization: Reference Use and URL Caching in ClassLoader Repository [reply] Description Ron Bodkin 2006-08-07 11:04:12 EDT I have found that a lot of memory can get pinned by the BCEL ClassLoaderRepository. For example, on a test configuration of Glassbox with WebLogic over 40 megabytes were pinned in memory due to this loader. (*)  I also notice that some of the time spent with loading and parsing redundant classes for shared weaving configuration could be reduced by having a global cache of bytes for URL's instead, i.e., the ClassLoaderRepository is local to a loader, so even if the same class on disk is resolved multiple times in different loaders, it isn't read from cache. This latter issue will be reduced if loading types from a parent loader use reflection delegates instead but BCEL still has to be used for aspects on <1.5 VM's...  The attached patch has some metrics in it to measure what's happening and it also uses SoftReferences to cache without pinning the reference types and uses a two-step look up process to maintain a global URL cache. When I run this on WebLogic 9.2 with Glassbox and view their admin console and some smaller apps I get this output:  BCEL repository total load time: 7733 ms, in url: 6029 ms for 1427 url cache hits = 1683 missEvicted = 0 missUrlEvicted= 0 all misses = 1427, loader hits = 0  On Tomcat 5.5 with some different sample apps: BCEL repository total load time: 4945 ms, in url: 4319 ms for 636 url cache hits = 548 missEvicted = 0 missUrlEvicted= 190 all misses= 446, loader hits = 3  So at least in my configuration the URL-based cache is quite effective (with almost a 50% hit rate) whereas the loader-based cache provides little value. From what I've seen, it's worth considering not even using the loader-based BCEL cache at all but others may have configurations where it helps.  (*) This test was on a development build of AspectJ which I had modified so that the LTWWorld evicts classes after loading  [reply] Comment 1 Ron Bodkin 2006-08-07 11:06:05 EDT Created attachment 47478 [details] Patch to bcel-builder module to use soft references, use a URL cache, and track metrics.  [reply] Comment 2 Ron Bodkin 2006-08-07 11:08:33 EDT I should point out that I haven't tested this approach in a build-time weaving or IDE environment. However, I'd be happy to do so after hearing some feedback on it.  [reply] Comment 3 Andrew Clement 2006-08-08 07:31:05 EDT patches applied - slightly reworked it - hope I haven't broken it - my rudimentary tests confirm it is behaving but I don't have any decent ltw configs.  I had to remove nanoTime - that's a 1.5 api, I'm not sure how accurate the totals will be with currentTimeMillis().  stats have to be requested, they aren't dumped out every X seconds, could make this configurable if we're unsure it's behaving.  A system property can turn off the sharing if it starts misbehaving (org.aspectj.apache.bcel.useSharedCache=false)  I don't currently see how keys/values are ever removed from the URL cache - i know they are smaller since only softrefs on one end, but we should be tidying up.  Maybe a queue and tidy up when queue isn't empty and a load/find is attempted.  Don't think it's relevant for command line one off compilation (one world) but AJDT may benefit from something similar when there are multiple AspectJ projects.  [reply] Comment 4 Ron Bodkin 2006-08-08 11:31:58 EDT You're right: the URL cache should probably be managed with a size limit or timing scheme to evict items. Using references would just mean the whole cache could be evicted when memory is low (nothing is going to have a handle on the URL's normally), so you could just have a soft reference to the cache as a whole.  I remember you had brought up some other LRU cache that's in Eclipse that might be suitable for use with the type map. Would that help here?  [reply] Comment 5 Ron Bodkin 2006-08-08 15:15:01 EDT I tested with AspectJ from CVS HEAD including this improved version of the repository code and it is working well, and improving performance. My profile shows that of 27.4 million bytes pinned by AspectJ the static cache is pinning 32k, so it's a pretty low memory user. However, it is better to clean up, so I added that logic and also added some tests.  I don't want to use a reference queue to clean up because then we'd need a reverse map from references to URLs. Instead, I just compress the repository every N accesses, iterating over it and purging any entry with a null value. I also added a property to allow changing the frequency of compaction. To disable it, set the value to zero.  Also, this static map has to be thread-safe (to avoid concurrent errors when so I updated the code to use a concurrent map. I just copied & pasted code from LTWWorld, but it would be better to make a public method makeConcurrentMap() on some ConcurrentFactory class that's shared between the bcel and weaver modules. I also made a small update (to track whether the map is synchronized, so we can synchronize the purge operation). In what module should the shared class go?  Note: the timings in the multi-threaded tests are not accurate in that they count elapsed time per thread, i.e., the threads are often waiting to run at the same time, so the times reported are four times too big. Even with heavy contention (with a quite high compacting frequency), a fairly big cache, and extremely frequent updates the time spent compacting is tiny (<10 ms in a total of 34 seconds, with a ridiculuous frequency of 1 in 10 it's only 170 ms).  I also proved that the multi-threaded tests were testing the right thing: I forgot to set the flag for is this a shared map and got a concurrent modification exception in that case (that's just a problem in the test case, which I fixed). Whew.  [reply] Comment 6 Ron Bodkin 2006-08-08 15:16:49 EDT Created attachment 47559 [details] Patch to weaver module to update tests for repository.  [reply] Comment 7 Ron Bodkin 2006-08-08 15:17:38 EDT Created attachment 47560 [details] Additional patch to bcel-builder, building on Andy's updates in HEAD.  [reply] Comment 8 Andrew Clement 2006-08-09 06:14:19 EDT Ron - can I ask why we don't just make the url cache a WeakHashMap? Do you know of somebody artificially holding onto the URL objects meaning the keys/values will never get cleared?  Or are you concerned that a WeakHashMap may be GC'd a bit too much for our liking by the VM? (in which case a LRU queue, of fixed size, from classname->URL may keep the most relevant entries alive)  [reply] Comment 9 Andrew Clement 2006-08-23 10:51:03 EDT are we happy we have done enough on this for 1.5.3 ?  [reply] Comment 10 Ron Bodkin 2006-08-23 11:47:35 EDT This looks good to me. Thanks!  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Problems with Cascading Parameters
description: Problems with Cascading Parameters [reply] Description D. Cruz 2006-09-20 17:50:25 EDT I'm running into an issue with using Cascading Parameters in the BIRT-viewer.  The Cascading parameters works fine when i first load the report page.  But when i load another page then use the back button on the browser the Cascading Parameters will no longer work.  The Parameters box will appear but selecting the first parameter in the Cascading group will not populate the second parameter selection.  Canceling out the box and clicking on the parametrs icon will also not get the Cascading Parameters to work again. Only a refresh of the page will get the Cascading Parameters to function correctly.  This issue is most likely to occure if i user decides to generate a pdf of the report and then press the back button to enter in new parameters for another report. While this isn't a major bug, it will cause confusion in users.  [reply] Comment 1 Ivy Li 2006-09-21 23:15:55 EDT *** Bug 158131 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***  [reply] Comment 2 Jerry Cheng 2006-09-24 22:38:25 EDT Force to not cache page.  [reply] Comment 3 D. Cruz 2006-09-24 22:41:04 EDT What build will this be avaliable in?  [reply] Comment 4 D. Cruz 2006-09-24 22:41:40 EDT Is this Fix avaliable in the latest nightly build?  [reply] Comment 5 Jerry Cheng 2006-09-24 23:01:45 EDT Has fixed in 2.2.0 build. Please check tomorrow nightly build.  [reply] Comment 6 Jerry Cheng 2006-09-27 04:11:38 EDT Block IE pdf preview. So revise and reopen it.  [reply] Comment 7 Jerry Cheng 2006-09-27 22:12:05 EDT Due to IE issue, if set "Cache-Control: No Cache" or "Cache-Control: No Store" in response header, pdf and other documents can't be opened correctly.  Please check here: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/812935/en-us  But Mozilla/Firefox are ok.  [reply] Comment 8 Jerry Cheng 2007-05-24 23:35:56 EDT Set "no-store" and "no-cache" for JSP files.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments
