summary: [Enhancement request] PHPDoc support for chain methods (fluent interface).
description: [Enhancement request] PHPDoc support for chain methods (fluent interface). [reply] Description Stan Vassilev 2009-05-13 09:56:01 EDT Build ID: M20080911-1700  Steps To Reproduce: There is no good way to type hint a method which returns $this.  Currently we only can specify the current class, which works fine, unless we extend the class, example:  class Foo { function fooMethod() {}  /** * @return Foo */ function fluentMethod() { return $this; } }  class Bar extends Foo { function barMethod() {} }  $bar = new Bar();  // if you type the code below you will see a hint about // about fooMethod(), but not about barMethod() as there // is no way to type hint the dynamic nature of fluent // interfaces that return $this:  $bar->fluentMethod()->...  Suggested behavior and syntax:  /** * @return self */ function fluentMethod() { return $this; }  When the above syntax is used, Eclipse PDT will assume the return class is the same class that invokes the method, never mind where in the inheritance chain the method itself was declared.  If this solution is deemed sound, I will also talk to people at phpDocumentor so it can be added to the PHPDoc standard.  [reply] Comment 1 Stan Vassilev 2009-05-14 10:27:22 EDT The bug was added to PEAR and it seems it'll go there as in few variations:  @return $this @return self  and possibly: @return static  http://pear.php.net/bugs/bug.php?id=16223  To avoid confusion, I suggest the following implementation with possibility to extend later:  "@return $this", only for non-static methods.  [reply] Comment 2 Dawid Pakula 2014-08-01 10:22:23 EDT *** Bug 434988 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***  [reply] Comment 3 Dawid Pakula 2014-08-04 05:11:21 EDT See also PSR-5 draft [1]  @return self   - works correctly now @return static - inherited class, static method @return $this  - inherited class, normal method  [1] - https://github.com/phpDocumentor/fig-standards/blob/master/proposed/phpdoc.md  [reply] Comment 4 Dawid Pakula 2015-01-18 18:50:09 EST *** Bug 347332 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***  [reply] Comment 5 Michal Niewrzal 2015-08-10 06:31:14 EDT *** Bug 474567 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***  [reply] Comment 6 Eclipse Genie 2015-08-10 06:36:58 EDT New Gerrit change created: https://git.eclipse.org/r/53467  [reply] Comment 7 Eclipse Genie 2015-08-10 16:35:45 EDT Gerrit change https://git.eclipse.org/r/53467 was merged to [master]. Commit: http://git.eclipse.org/c/pdt/org.eclipse.pdt.git/commit/?id=369129b2fff3f1a91b4a513c800553eb9cb5c7e7  [reply] Comment 8 Michal Niewrzal 2015-08-10 16:36:57 EDT Fixed. description: Accessibility checklist for DTP documentation [reply] Description Brian Payton 2009-05-15 01:23:35 EDT Created attachment 135913 [details] Documentation Accessibility Checklist - DTP 1.7 - working draft  I found out that just like the code, the documentation for a software project has Accessibility requirements too.  So Emily gets to join the fun! :-)  "Accessible" software is software that can be used effectively by people with visual or other disabilities.  Examples of making software accessible is providing keyboard alternatives to mouse actions and making it possible for a user to navigate a user interface using screen reader software that "speaks" the content of the screen.  DTP should be accessible. It's not merely a "good thing to do"; many government agencies and purchase contracts require that the software purchased be accessible, and we would like the products based on DTP to qualify.  Please take a few minutes to download the attached Software Accessibility Checklist, fill it out, and re-attach it to this bug.  Mark the Status column of each item as Yes, No, or NA.  Provide comments when necessary.  For more information about the accessibility and the Software Accessibility Checklist, visit http://www-03.ibm.com/able/guidelines/software/accesssoftware.html  Thanks! summary: XMPP messages are sent to wrong receiver when using multiple logins
description: XMPP messages are sent to wrong receiver when using multiple logins [reply] Description J?rg Rathlev 2009-05-15 13:47:47 EDT Created attachment 136036 [details] Proposed patch  When using multiple logins with the same username, messages are sent to the user which logged in last, instead of the specific username/resourceID that was specified.  In the class org.eclipse.ecf.internal.provider.xmpp.smack.ECFConnection, the method #sendMessage(ID, Message) determines the receiver for the XMPP message based on the IDs getUsernameAtHost(), which does not include the XMPP resource ID. If rcvr.getFQName() is used instead, the problem disappears.  [reply] Comment 1 Scott Lewis 2009-05-15 13:54:16 EDT Setting target milestone to RC2 and adding Remy, Marcelo for review of proposed fix/patch. summary: Strange Endpoint IP Address in generated WSDL
description: Strange Endpoint IP Address in generated WSDL [reply] Description Renat Zubairov 2009-06-18 03:09:46 EDT Build ID: RC4  Steps To Reproduce: When Swordfish (CXF) generates a WSDL based on the service interface it usually has an Endpoint with 0.0.0.0 as an IP Address which is not the best choice for targeting at localhost, would be better if "localhost" could be used instead.  More information:  [reply] Comment 1 Volodymyr Zhabiuk 2009-07-08 04:45:48 EDT The 0.0.0.0 ip address is in the http endpoint configuration. If we change this to "localhost" the generated wsdl will also contain localhost URI  [reply] Comment 2 Renat Zubairov 2009-07-08 05:01:26 EDT Hi. That's exactly what is needed. Generated WSDL shouldn't contain this wired 0.0.0.0 since no other tool except CXF understands it :(  For example SOAP UI or WSDL Explorer.  [reply] Comment 3 Volodymyr Zhabiuk 2009-07-10 05:14:32 EDT Have fixed that in Swordfish samples. We need to make sure that Tooling generates endpoints with "localhost" instead of 0.0.0.0  [reply] Comment 4 Volodymyr Zhabiuk 2009-07-10 05:15:27 EDT See the previos comment  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: EPF richtext editor doesn't work with tab
description: EPF richtext editor doesn't work with tab [reply] Description Tao Weng 2009-07-02 10:03:33 EDT Build ID: latest  Steps To Reproduce: It is not possible to use the tab key to create tabs in EPF richtext editor. Using the tab key will change focus to the main toolbar under the main menu.   More information:  [reply] Comment 1 Bingxue Xu 2009-07-06 14:42:35 EDT please investigate this.  [reply] Comment 2 Jose Alfredo Serrano 2009-07-08 08:22:04 EDT Created attachment 141072 [details] Project to reproduce the focus lost with tab key  The RichText is nested within a dialog. Use the contributed nested action to display the dialog.  [reply] Comment 3 Jose Alfredo Serrano 2009-07-08 08:23:17 EDT With the latest version (nightly build 20090701), when the RichText loose focus using the TAB key, it is not possible to gain the focus again using the mouse. No more edition is possible. The only way to gain the focus again to allow edition is to press TAB through all focusable controls until we come back again to the editor.  [reply] Comment 4 Jose Alfredo Serrano 2009-07-08 08:31:56 EDT I think my post does not correspond to the problem described here. I will open a new issue  [reply] Comment 5 Xiao Dan Xia 2009-07-10 01:41:55 EDT In EPF, the original design is to use Tab key and Ctrl-Tab key to move between fields, Shift-Tab key is used to move in reverse order. The fix will use Ctrl-Tab key for RTE to insert "tab" into text field.  [reply] Comment 6 Bingxue Xu 2009-07-15 18:15:55 EDT From Dancy:  1. The default behavior of Tab key on Windows(IE) is to move between fields, while on Linux(Firefox), Tab key is used to type in "tab" into the text field 2. In EPFC, our original design is to use Tab key and Ctrl-Tab key to move between fields, Shift-Tab key is used to move in reverse order. No way to type in "Tab" into the text field. 3. We changed Ctrl-tab key's behavior. With the attached patch, Ctrl-Tab key is used for RTE to insert "tab" into text field. The solution is to intercept Ctrl-tab key pressing event and dynamically insert 4 "space" to the place where the cursor is.  [reply] Comment 7 Xiao Dan Xia 2009-07-17 10:53:20 EDT changed files: rte.js richtext.java  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: consecutive ';' in package path causes compiler errors
description: consecutive ';' in package path causes compiler errors [reply] Description Dave Russo 2009-07-29 18:14:07 EDT if XDCPATH is set to a value containing two or more consecutive ';'s the C compiler is passed an empty -I option which causes it to fail.  For example, when building a package containing at least one C file xdc XDCPATH="c:/users/dr/repo;;" fails to build but xdc XDCPATH="c:/users/dr/repo;" works.  We currently filter the package path on windows to handle spaces, we should also remove strings of ';'s.  [reply] Comment 1 Vikram Adiga 2012-02-22 19:15:21 EST Added fix to replace consecutive ';'s with a single ';'.  Fix will be released in the next release of xdcutils (xdcutils-g06) and xdc (xdc-z08).  [reply] Comment 2 Dave Russo 2013-02-26 15:13:50 EST also fixed in xdc-y51 (xdctools 3.24.07)  [reply] Comment 3 Dave Russo 2013-02-27 11:41:08 EST verified by successfully building idioms/i101 with the xdctools 3.25.0.40 command xdc XDCPATH="c:/users/dr/repo;;;;"  verified that the changes made to xdc.c were also made in the 3.24 stream.  [reply] Comment 4 Dave Russo 2013-04-04 17:07:42 EDT shipped in 3.25.00.48: http://downloads.ti.com/dsps/dsps_public_sw/sdo_sb/targetcontent/rtsc/3_25_00_48/index_FDS.html.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: [BIDI3.5]The Bidirectional properties of JDBC data   source that has been set previously by the user can   not be retrieved again after disabling bidi   properties in JDBC data source
description: [BIDI3.5]The Bidirectional properties of JDBC data   source that has been set previously by the user can   not be retrieved again after disabling bidi   properties in JDBC data source [reply] Description Marwa Arafa 2009-08-10 01:49:31 EDT Build ID: birt-report-designer-all-in-one-2_5_1-N20090803  Steps To Reproduce: 1.Start Eclipse and set the preferences of the workspace as follows: Go to Window ->preferences->Report Design-> Bidirectional Properties->JDBC Data Source, and set the Bidirectional properties to values different from the default value ; for example use the values as shown in image "preferences.bmp" in the attachment.  2.Create New "Report Project" , create a new Report "Blank Report" and click finish.  3.Create a new "JDBC data source", set Driver Class to "org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.sampledb.Driver (Classic Models Inc. SampleDB Driver)"& set the Driver URL to "jdbc:classicmodels:sampledb"  4.Click "Bidi settings" button , & check the "Disable Bidi transformation" check box as shown in image "Bidi Properties_1.bmp" then click "OK".  5.Click on "Bidi Settings" button again.  Expected Result:  The "Disable Bidi Transformation" check box remains checked, And all bidi properties have the same values that were set by the user.Refer to image "bidi properties_1.bmp" in the attached file.  Actual Result:  The "Disable Bidi Transformation" check box has been unchecked, And all bidi properties have been reset to the design default values.Refer to image "bidi properties_Actual Result.bmp" in the attached file.   More information: Please refer to the attached files.  [reply] Comment 1 Marwa Arafa 2009-08-10 01:53:07 EDT Created attachment 143863 [details] Screenshots for the preferences, Actual and Expected results  [reply] Comment 2 Mingxia Wu 2010-05-13 03:39:26 EDT The Bidirectional properties of JDBC data source that has been set previously by the user can not be retrieved again after disabling bidi properties in JDBC data source  BIDI UI issue is introduced by the code IBM contributed  [reply] Comment 3 Wenjie Tu 2010-11-01 03:53:04 EDT Bidi feature is contributed by IBM and then integrated into BIRT. As to the issue that the "Disable Bidi Transform" checkbox status set from "Advanced Bidi Data Source Settings" dialog is never saved, I'd asked IBM devolper, Ira Fishbein, by mail and the answer was "this option is never saved, but checking this option resets Bidi settings and they become Logical LeftToRight".  Ira, I've inlcuded you into the CC list, could you please make an investigation? thanks.  [reply] Comment 4 Ira Fishbein 2010-11-08 05:04:04 EST Hi, I am suggesting the following design: Two new properties will be added and they will store the disabled settings. Existence of those properties will point to the fact that the "disable" checkbox was checked by user. If user didn't check this checkbox, the properties wouldn't exist. If this approach is acceptable, i'll implement it. Please update me with your comments. Thank you, Ira  [reply] Comment 5 Wenjie Tu 2010-11-08 22:04:03 EST Ira, Let's go on with your suggestion.  Thanks, Wenjie  [reply] Comment 6 Ira Fishbein 2010-11-22 02:40:11 EST Created attachment 183548 [details] patch for org.eclipse.birt.report.data.bidi.utils plugin  [reply] Comment 7 Ira Fishbein 2010-11-22 02:40:47 EST Created attachment 183549 [details] patch for org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc.ui plugin  [reply] Comment 8 Ira Fishbein 2010-11-22 02:41:24 EST Hi, I've attached patches with my code changes. Ira  [reply] Comment 9 Zhang Lei 2010-11-24 03:32:28 EST use the patch from IBM for BIDI properties. fix this issue.  [reply] Comment 10 Xiaoying Gu 2010-11-24 03:48:19 EST Verified in 2.6.2.v20101124-0630  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

Logs from these tests should be archived in a web site for review by the team  [reply] Comment 1 Amit Mookerjee 2009-08-28 21:00:09 EDT As part of this activity some tests must be developed and executed on simulator platform using DSS. For XDCtools 3.16 at least 2 new platforms must be used and a subset of tests must be built in both COFF and ELF formats.  [reply] Comment 2 Dave Russo 2010-07-12 20:05:38 EDT *** Bug 318360 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***  [reply] Comment 3 Vikram Adiga 2013-04-01 18:17:41 EDT Jenkins jobs for Windows XP (xdctest_Windows) and Windows 7 (xdctest_Windows7) have been set-up to test XDCtools after every release.  The tests are built and run for ti.targets.C28_large (i.e. a COFF target), ti.targets.elf.C674 (i.e. a ELF target) and native targets.  [reply] Comment 4 Sasha Slijepcevic 2014-03-12 15:11:06 EDT xdctools_Windows (for XP), xdctools_Windows7 and xdctools_Windows8 are running on Jenkins after each new xdcprod tree. There are COFF and ELF targets used.  [reply] Comment 5 Dave Russo 2015-02-14 22:39:48 EST clean out old verified bugs  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: The dirty status cannot be fired for the first operation in RTE on Window platform
description: The dirty status cannot be fired for the first operation in RTE on Window platform [reply] Description Xiao Dan Xia 2009-08-31 05:58:35 EDT User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.0.13) Gecko/2009073022 Firefox/3.0.13 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729) Build Identifier: 1.5.0.1  Steps to reproduce: 1. Open any method element in editor, such a role. 2. Enter a character (please notes: you should enter only one character), such as "a", to any RTE. 3. The dirty status cannot be fired and the save/saveAll button is still disabled.   Reproducible: Always  [reply] Comment 1 Bingxue Xu 2009-08-31 14:40:24 EDT Created attachment 146096 [details] patch for this bug  [reply] Comment 2 Xiao Dan Xia 2009-09-01 04:02:34 EDT To set dirty flag, when receiving keyEvent, EPF compares the text returned by browser with initial text, if they are different, the dirty flag is set.  This bug is because EPF is listening to KeyPressed event, that way returned text is the one before typing in characters. So the comparison result is no difference. The solution is to change KeyReleased event otherthan KeyPressed event.  Changed files: RichText.java  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: The status of tool bar cannot be refreshed when using crtl+b, crtl+u, crtl+i
description: The status of tool bar cannot be refreshed when using crtl+b, crtl+u, crtl+i [reply] Description Xiao Dan Xia 2009-09-01 05:05:59 EDT User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.0.13) Gecko/2009073022 Firefox/3.0.13 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729) Build Identifier: 1.5.0.1  Steps to reproduce:  1. Enter a string in any RTE. 2. Use "ctrl+b" to set bold font. 3. The tool button "B" on the tool bar of RTE is not highlighted. It should be highlighted to indicate the current font is bold font. 4. The same issue for "ctrl+i" and "ctrl+u"  Reproducible: Always  [reply] Comment 1 Xiao Dan Xia 2009-09-02 05:02:01 EDT solution:  Once the browser gets the Ctrl+(command key) event, it executes script function updateSelection().  After that, the tool button will get the notification to set check/uncheck status.  Changed files: RichText.java  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: CreateUnspecifiedTypeRequest cannot be coumpound with a DeferredCreateConnectionViewAndElementCommand
description: CreateUnspecifiedTypeRequest cannot be coumpound with a DeferredCreateConnectionViewAndElementCommand [reply] Description Mickael Istria 2009-09-05 09:17:58 EDT Since the CreateUnspecifiedTypeRequest does not return an adapter to the new object, it is impossible to use it in a CompundCommand with a  DeferredCreateConnectionViewAndElementCommand, as shown in the GMF tutorial example http://wiki.eclipse.org/GMF_Tutorial_Part_3#Custom_Actions.  An interesting return value for getNewObject would be an adapter that would delegate to the CreationRequest that actually performed the command.  [reply] Comment 1 Mickael Istria 2009-09-07 09:06:25 EDT Created attachment 146601 [details] Proposed patch  This patch adds a CreateUnspecifiedAdapter, returned by a CreateUnspecifiedTypeCommand, that delegates its getAdapter method to the request that actually realized the command, when it can be guessed.  [reply] Comment 2 Eclipse Webmaster 2010-07-19 21:58:25 EDT [GMF Restructure] Bug 319140 : product GMF and component Runtime was the original product and component for this bug  [reply] Comment 3 Aurelien Pupier 2010-11-22 16:26:20 EST patch applied  [reply] Comment 4 Anthony Hunter 2011-02-22 10:45:03 EST Created attachment 189503 [details] Patch to fix the issue.  Hi Mickael, we need to add an @since tag on the new class otherwise API Tools flags an error.  [reply] Comment 5 Mickael Istria 2011-02-22 10:46:53 EST Thanks Antony, my API-tools was not configured when I wrote this patch...  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: The dirty status cannot be fired after make some changes to RTE in tailoring perspective.
description: The dirty status cannot be fired after make some changes to RTE in tailoring perspective. [reply] Description Xiao Dan Xia 2009-09-21 05:17:23 EDT User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.1.3) Gecko/20090824 Firefox/3.5.3 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729) Build Identifier: 1.5.0.1  Steps to reproduce: 1. Switch to tailoring perspective. 2. Open a process in any tailoring session. 3. In Description page of process editor, open the rich text editor of Main description. 4. Make some changes in this opened rich text editor. 5. The dirty status was not fired.  Reproducible: Always  [reply] Comment 1 Xiao Dan Xia 2009-09-21 05:58:45 EDT It's a bug of class ProcessDescription, it redefines variable contentModifyListener which is already defined in its base class DescriptionFormPage. I removed the definition from ProcessDescription  [reply] Comment 2 Bingxue Xu 2009-09-21 13:54:28 EDT Created attachment 147718 [details] patch for 289979  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Process editor can be opened more than one times for the same element.
description: Process editor can be opened more than one times for the same element. [reply] Description Xiao Dan Xia 2009-09-22 02:12:47 EDT User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.1.3) Gecko/20090824 Firefox/3.5.3 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729) Build Identifier: 1.5.0.1  1. Open a CP. 2. Open any of RTE in this process editor. 3. Double click the opened CP in library view. [Problem] Another process editor for this opened CP open again. This may cause data lost if modify the same field in two editor for one element. [Excepted] Only one editor should be opened for one element.   Reproducible: Always  [reply] Comment 1 Xiao Dan Xia 2009-09-22 02:45:13 EDT Created attachment 147761 [details] add matchingStrategy for processEditor  [reply] Comment 2 Xiao Dan Xia 2009-09-22 02:47:30 EDT The root cause is that MethodElementEditorMatchingStrategy is not added into processEditor, which results in the opened existing processEditor doesn't match the editor to be opened, therefore a new process editor is opened.  solution: add matchingStrategy for processEditor  changed files: plugin.xml in plugin org.eclipse.epf.authoring.ui  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: [storages] JPA :: allow for custom definition in config what data types are used :: switch all to orm.xml
description: [storages] JPA :: allow for custom definition in config what data types are used :: switch all to orm.xml [reply] Description thomas menzel 2009-10-08 08:26:22 EDT ATM the datatypes are hard coded as annotations in code. the value used there seems to be taken verbatim to create the table.  this poses at least a problem for SQL Server as it doesnt know the defined BLOB type used in all cases store binaries.  as a consequence, integrating other DBs means to modify the DAO classes.  see also mail thread http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/smila-dev/msg00600.html  [reply] Comment 1 thomas menzel 2009-10-12 04:03:47 EDT resources * http://wiki.eclipse.org/EclipseLink/Release * http://www.jpox.org/docs/jpa/orm_xml.html * http://wiki.eclipse.org/Introduction_to_Java_Persistence_API_%28ELUG%29#persistence.xml_File * http://wiki.eclipse.org/Using_EclipseLink_JPA_Extensions_%28ELUG%29#Overriding_Annotations_with_XML * - seems like the persistence.xml can take mapfile locations. if we have one by default in config then this just needs to be mod'ed to suite the needs. * http://wiki.eclipse.org/Using_EclipseLink_JPA_Extensions_%28ELUG%29#What_You_May_Need_to_Know_About_Overriding_Annotations_in_JPA  the target is to either keep the annotations as they are and to provide means to override just certain mappings or to get rid of the annotations and provide a standard map file in config that may be adapted to needs.  h2. solution: mapping from config folder it seems that this doesnt work. JPA spec states in 6.2.1.6 mapping-file, jar-file, class, exclude-unlisted-classes  Alternatively, or in addition, other mapping files may be referenced by the mapping- file elements of the persistence-unit element, and may be present anywhere on the class path.  h3. alternative: subclass org.eclipse.persistence.platform.database.DatabasePlatform and provide a buildFieldTypes() than can be overridden in the config area  drawback: not possible to define a complete diff. mapping  h3. alternative: have optional require bundle to a custome ORM jar since that is then on the CP it can hold the new mapping  [reply] Comment 2 thomas menzel 2009-10-13 16:07:42 EDT == INFOS ==  === DYNAMIC MAPPING === http://wiki.eclipse.org/EclipseLink/Development/JPA/Dynamic seems like this could solve the problem for real but it is still in WIP  ==  3.  alternative : converters == http://wiki.eclipse.org/Introduction_to_Mappings_%28ELUG%29#Mapping_Converters_and_Transformers dont think that this is worth the effort  == subclass target == http://wiki.eclipse.org/Using_EclipseLink_JPA_Extensions_(ELUG)#Using_EclipseLink_JPA_Extensions_for_Session.2C_Target_Database_and_Target_Application_Server  eclipselink.target-database ... You can also set the value to the fully qualified classname of a subclass of the org.eclipse.persistence.platform.DatabasePlatform class.  === switching to orm.xml === the first thing i do before impling the subclass is to switch from annotation mapping to ORM.xml reason: since we cant to define the full mapping in configuration, it is better to provide an orm.xml that can be edited in place than having to modify annotations and then have recompile.  life saver for debugging: -Dequinox.ds.print=true  [reply] Comment 3 thomas menzel 2009-10-14 09:38:41 EDT === subclass wrapper : not possible === creating a wrapper for the DB Platforms dont work, as i would need to delegate to internal/non-exported methods of superclass.  === more input requested ===  ATM i think we may just need to live that the user needs to change the orm.xml. however, i posted on EL forum for a solution. see http://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php?t=msg&th=155948&start=0&S=a546132bd2b592c64dc43afb2d537b9a  [reply] Comment 4 thomas menzel 2009-10-16 05:14:34 EDT i extended the issues name to denote what was done in the end, namely just to switch from annotations to orm.xml usage to make it configurable w/o having to recompile bundles.  plz open another bug to track changes that go further than this.  [reply] Comment 5 thomas menzel 2009-10-16 05:14:45 EDT Created attachment 149726 [details] mylyn/context/zip  [reply] Comment 6 Andreas Weber 2013-04-15 11:45:04 EDT Closing this  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: [EWM] Remote containment references on WorkflowParameter
description: [EWM] Remote containment references on WorkflowParameter [reply] Description Bryan Hunt 2009-12-05 13:48:38 EST I propose removing the containment reference from WorkflowComponent to WorkflowParameter.  In practice, the generic containment seems to be rather inconvenient.  Unless there is a compelling argument to keep the current design, I will remove the reference.  Extensions to WorkflowUnitOfWork would then create the containment references where they would be most useful.  [reply] Comment 1 Bryan Hunt 2010-01-03 12:01:01 EST Fix delivered to HEAD  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: [EWM] Split WorkflowContext into transactional and non-transactional functionality
description: [EWM] Split WorkflowContext into transactional and non-transactional functionality [reply] Description Bryan Hunt 2009-12-05 13:58:49 EST The WorkflowContext currently depends on EMF Transaction to support parallel workflows.  There are many use-cases that are strictly serial workflows, and adding the dependency and overhead of EMF Transaction is unnecessary.  I propose splitting WorkflowContext into WorkflowContext and WorkflowTransactionalContext.  WorkflowContext would support serial workflows only and not depend on EMF Transaction.  WorkflowTransactionalContext would support both serial and parallel workflows, and depend on EMF Transaction.  WorkflowTransactionalContext would be in a separate bundle so that serial workflows could be constructed without having any dependencies on EMF Transaction.  [reply] Comment 1 Bryan Hunt 2010-01-03 16:22:37 EST Changed delivered to HEAD  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: "Scroll to File Start Address" not honored when importing memory from within MemoryBrowser
description: "Scroll to File Start Address" not honored when importing memory from within MemoryBrowser [reply] Description Teodor Madan 2009-12-07 11:39:04 EST User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.1.5) Gecko/20091102 Firefox/3.5.5 Build Identifier: 20090619-0625  When downloading data to memory from within Memory Browser the rendering is not reposition if user chooses "Scroll to File Start Address"  Reproducible: Always  Steps to Reproduce: 1.Start a CDI-GDB MI session 2.Open Memory Browser. By default it will be positioned at address 0 3.Hit "Import" action from memory browser toolbar. 4.From the "Download to Memory" dialog select a file to import and check "Scroll to File Start Address". 5. Hit "Ok". After import is completed expecting for rendering to be repositioned to the restore address. Nothing happens.  If doing same operation from "Memory View", rendering is repositioned  [reply] Comment 1 John Cortell 2009-12-07 11:54:24 EST I think we can more simply state the problem to be that the checkbox is not wired to any of the import logic, either in CDT (Memory Browser) or in DSDP (Traditional Rendering). I.e., whether it's checked or unchecked has absolutely no effect on behavior.  [reply] Comment 2 Teodor Madan 2009-12-07 13:03:39 EST Created attachment 153943 [details] Fix  Fix in ImportMemoryDialog#scrollRenderings to use public rendering container api to reposition i.e. IMemoryRenderingContainer.  Additionally, change "Scroll to File Start Address"  to "Scroll to restore address". The later describe better the effect of the check-box.  [reply] Comment 3 John Cortell 2009-12-07 16:53:44 EST Teo, thanks for the fix. You addressed the fact that the scroll-to-restore-address operation was was not working for the standard renderings in the Memory View (it was only working for Traditional Rendering and Memory Browser). That's definitely a needed fix. However, the issue I had stumbled on was that the checkbox is flat out being ignored. The handling of the checkbox is all screwy; there is some significant confusion in the code as to how to deal with it.  I've fixed that problem and created a new patch that contains both fixes (yours and mine)  [reply] Comment 4 John Cortell 2009-12-07 16:54:16 EST Created attachment 153964 [details] new fix  [reply] Comment 5 John Cortell 2009-12-07 16:56:57 EST Correction. The scrolling was working for the standard renderings in the Memory View, but was not working for Traditional Rendering (in Memory View) or Memory Browser.  [reply] Comment 6 John Cortell 2009-12-07 17:01:33 EST Committed to HEAD. Randy, please review.  [reply] Comment 7 Randy Rohrbach 2009-12-08 13:00:09 EST Seems good to me.  Randy  [reply] Comment 8 Teodor Madan 2010-01-18 10:02:19 EST According to Status field definition the issue should have been moved into "RESOLVED" state  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Text_putMod can overflow when Text.isLoaded = false
description: Text_putMod can overflow when Text.isLoaded = false [reply] Description Chris McCormick 2010-01-27 13:13:31 EST Text_putMod doesn¨t appear to respect it¨s maximum length parameter if it displays one of the default ＾{module#2035}￣ type strings instead of the module name. These default strings are displayed when Text.isLoaded = false.  The code could be modified relatively easily to check the string's length, but the challenge is deciding the best behavior for the API when this is case.  Here is the logic for checking the string length.  For {module#1234}, len needs to be >= (9 + 5),  where 9 is the number of characters in ＾{module#}￣ and 5 is the maximum number of digits in a 16-bit module id.  For {module-rope:ABCD}, len needs to be >= (14 + 4), where "{module-rope:}" is 14 characters, and the 16-bit number is at most 4 hex digits.  [reply] Comment 1 Vikram Adiga 2012-02-22 19:20:23 EST Replaced call to sprintf with snprintf which will eliminate the buffer overflow bug.  Fix will be released in the next release of xdc (xdc-z08).  [reply] Comment 2 Sasha Slijepcevic 2013-03-01 19:17:45 EST - verified by running the following code: Text_putMod(0x8002, NULL, 5); where 0x8002 is an existing module ID for that configuration, and the text is not loaded. For 3.24, the output is: {module-rope:8002} and the third parameter 'length' is ignored. For 3.25.00.42, the output is: {mod  That is the correct output, and one character is used for '\0'.  [reply] Comment 3 Sasha Slijepcevic 2013-03-01 19:19:13 EST Also, I verified that the source code uses xprintf with the parameter 'len' that limits the number of characters that are printed.  [reply] Comment 4 Dave Russo 2013-04-04 17:08:05 EDT shipped in 3.25.00.48: http://downloads.ti.com/dsps/dsps_public_sw/sdo_sb/targetcontent/rtsc/3_25_00_48/index_FDS.html.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Refactor ListenerList to use generics
description: Refactor ListenerList to use generics [reply] Description Florian Thienel 2010-02-12 03:31:51 EST In order to reduce the number of compiler warnings I refactored org.eclipse.wst.xml.vex.core.internal.core.ListenerList to use generics (see the attachment).  [reply] Comment 1 Florian Thienel 2010-02-12 03:33:39 EST Created attachment 158960 [details] refactoring of ListernList plus a unit test for ListenerList  [reply] Comment 2 Holger Voormann 2010-02-12 05:39:33 EST Looks good: patch applied to HEAD  [reply] Comment 3 Holger Voormann 2010-02-16 14:35:41 EST Released (I20100216185302). Thank you for the contribution.  [reply] Comment 4 Holger Voormann 2010-02-18 01:31:13 EST The following problem was introduced by the change:  If Vex and Outline view is opened then not all listener are fired. This is caused because the listener's methods are invoke by the class given by the first listener instance instead of the given interface (the listener of the editor and listener of the Outline view are different classes but each of them implements the same interface).  Unfortunately, this means we need a parameter to specify the class/interface (the type of the actual generic parameter is unknown at runtime). I committed the fix. Florian, could you please review ListenerList?  [reply] Comment 5 Florian Thienel 2010-02-18 15:32:39 EST Created attachment 159480 [details] infer method per listener  There is one possibility to eliminate this listener class parameter. You can infer and cache the method for each registered listener, as I implemented exemplarily in this patch. But I have no idea if this has a performance penalty. Plus: the caching code is a little bit ugly, using a special inner key class.  [reply] Comment 6 Holger Voormann 2010-02-18 15:59:24 EST (In reply to comment #5) > ... But I have no idea if this has a performance penalty. Plus: the caching > code is a little bit ugly, using a special inner key class. > I also think the costs are too high only to eliminate one parameter. Please reopen the bug if you disagree or if you find some issues by the last change.  Again, thanks for the contribution.  [reply] Comment 7 Florian Thienel 2011-06-02 05:22:11 EDT Closing resolved bugs.  [reply] Comment 8 Florian Thienel 2011-11-09 17:36:17 EST Moved to Mylyn Docs Vex. summary: PropertyDecl should better provide a Comparator for cascade ordering
description: PropertyDecl should better provide a Comparator for cascade ordering [reply] Description Florian Thienel 2010-02-17 14:27:29 EST According to Findbugs, the cascade order of PropertyDecl instances is not conform with the contract of compareTo in combination with equals. It is better to use a Comparator<PropertyDecl> here.  While trying to add a test case for PropertyDecl, I found that Rule.source, which is used in PropertyDecl.getWeight, is not used anywhere else. So I additionaly removed the field from Rule, StyleSheetReader and PropertyDecl.getWeight. The rest of PropertyDecl is already covered in RuleTest and CssTest.  (see my attachment)  [reply] Comment 1 Florian Thienel 2010-02-17 14:28:17 EST Created attachment 159362 [details] The refactoring of PropertyDecl  [reply] Comment 2 Holger Voormann 2010-02-18 02:03:35 EST Looks good: patch applied to HEAD  In addition I made PropertyDecl and Rule immutable.  Unfortunately, the "equals" methods of the comparator and of PropertyDecl still differ.  [reply] Comment 3 Florian Thienel 2010-02-18 03:13:56 EST (In reply to comment #2) > Unfortunately, the "equals" methods of the comparator and of PropertyDecl still > differ.  I think that is ok. The "equal" of the comparator only means that both compared objects are equal in the sense of the cascading order. Whereas "equals" of PropertyDecl means that both objects are equal in every sense.  [reply] Comment 4 Holger Voormann 2010-02-18 04:00:17 EST (In reply to comment #3) > The "equal" of the comparator only means that both compared > objects are equal in the sense of the cascading order. Whereas "equals" of > PropertyDecl means that both objects are equal in every sense. > Then we should better move CASCADE_ORDERING to StyleSheet, shouldn't we?  [reply] Comment 5 Florian Thienel 2010-02-18 04:37:02 EST (In reply to comment #4) > Then we should better move CASCADE_ORDERING to StyleSheet, shouldn't we?  It is no public API and seems to be an implementation detail of StyleSheet according to this comment:  // Sort in cascade order. We can then just stuff them into a // map and get the right values since higher-priority values // come later and overwrite lower-priority ones.  So yes. I also think we should move it.  [reply] Comment 6 Holger Voormann 2010-02-18 04:52:25 EST (In reply to comment #5) > So yes. I also think we should move it. Done.  FindBug issue resloved, 73 to go...  Thank you for the contribution.  [reply] Comment 7 Florian Thienel 2011-11-09 17:36:14 EST Moved to Mylyn Docs Vex.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: ti.targets.ITarget.getVersion is unnecessarily slow
description: ti.targets.ITarget.getVersion is unnecessarily slow [reply] Description Dave Russo 2010-02-26 11:14:00 EST The TI compiler supports an option, Ccompiler_revision, that _only_ displays the revision of the compiler.  We are current using Cversion which displays the version of _every_ underlying tool (Parser, File Merge, Optimizer, Codegen, Consultant Generator, Strip, Object File Display, ´)  which we filter to get just the compiler version.  Worse, I believe it does this by invoking each of these 21 utilities individually(!).  We should "fix" the TI targets to use Ccompiler_revision rather than Cversion to eliminate this unnecessary overhead.  [reply] Comment 1 Vikram Adiga 2012-01-17 14:29:18 EST All TI targets updated to use --compiler_revision.  [reply] Comment 2 Vikram Adiga 2012-01-24 14:17:20 EST will be fixed in xdctargets-f14  [reply] Comment 3 Dave Russo 2012-02-09 14:36:14 EST verified by inspection of the ti.targets specification files: [sanblnx02 2492] pwd .../xdctools_3_23_01_40_eng/packages/ti/targets [sanblnx02 2493] find . -name "*.xdc" -exec grep '\-vers' {} /dev/null \; [sanblnx02 2494] find . -name "*.xdc" -exec grep '\-compiler' {} /dev/null \; ./arm/IArm.xdc:        opts: "--compiler_revision" ./arm/elf/IArm.xdc:        opts: "--compiler_revision" ./elf/C64P.xdc:        opts: "--compiler_revision" ./elf/C64P_big_endian.xdc:        opts: "--compiler_revision" ./elf/C64T.xdc:        opts: "--compiler_revision" ./elf/C64T_big_endian.xdc:        opts: "--compiler_revision" ./elf/C66.xdc:        opts: "--compiler_revision" ./elf/C66_big_endian.xdc:        opts: "--compiler_revision" ./elf/C674.xdc:        opts: "--compiler_revision" : ./msp430/elf/MSP430X.xdc:        opts: "--compiler_revision" ./msp430/elf/MSP430X_small.xdc:        opts: "--compiler_revision" [sanblnx02 2495]  [reply] Comment 4 Dave Russo 2013-01-24 15:11:57 EST xdctools 3.23.05 GA is available from here: http://www.sanb.design.ti.com/tisb_releases/XDCtools/3_23_05_61/  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Provide support for automatic tagging and map file updating
description: Provide support for automatic tagging and map file updating [reply] Description Kenn Hussey 2010-04-14 11:40:39 EDT The "old" build system we used for EMF supported automatic tagging of source files in CVS and updated the associated map file accordingly. In order to switch over to the Buckminster build for EMF, we would need the same/similar support.  The idea here is that the revisions of the source that are used for a given build are tagged based on the build ID (timestamp) so that we can associate the contents of a build with specific source and load the corresponding revisions into a workspace using a map file. Of course, this should be an optional feature, in case folks still want to use the commit and release (tag) approach (in which case the build should be able to use a specific map file or equivalent cspec).  [reply] Comment 1 Henrik Lindberg 2010-05-04 12:43:34 EDT When fixed, please log a documentation issue, and describe what needs to be documented.  [reply] Comment 2 Thomas Hallgren 2010-05-18 08:33:57 EDT Michal, can we close this one?  [reply] Comment 3 Thomas Hallgren 2010-06-09 04:32:32 EDT ping  [reply] Comment 4 Michal Ruzicka 2010-08-18 08:37:17 EDT A generic tagging support has been implemented, however it is not capable of performing the actual tagging without support in individual repository providers. Such a support has only been implemented in the CVSReaderType provider. (Bug #323007 tracks a request to implement the support in other relevant providers.)  The tagging support is exposed in the form of a buckminster actor and is used from CSPEC/CSPEX files like this: <cs:public name="tag" actor="buckminster.tag"> <cs:actorProperties> <cs:property key="tag" value="build_${build.id}" /> <cs:property key="exclude.0" value="^org\.example\.library(?:\..+)?$" /> <cs:property key="exclude.1" value="^org\.example\.test(?:\..+)?$" /> <cs:property key="include.0" value="^org\.example\.library\.extensions(?:\..+)?$" /> </cs:actorProperties> </cs:public>  where: "buckminster.tag" is the name of the buckminster actor implementing the tagging support "tag" is the property defining the tag to use when tagging the resources "exclude.<n>" are regular expression patterns denoting components to exclude from tagging "include.<n>" are regular expression patterns denoting components to include in the tagging operation regardless if they are matched by any number of "exclude.<n>" patterns  The tagging is performed on the current component (the component in which the CSPEC or CSPEX containing the above definition is found) and all its dependencies (even transitive) which happen to be present in the workspace.  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Provide a SSH key location preference
description: Provide a SSH key location preference [reply] Description Kenn Hussey 2010-04-22 17:36:08 EDT Now that support for CVS tagging is being provided (see bug 309151), there should be a way to specify/control the location of the SSH key that is used for authentication.  [reply] Comment 1 Thomas Hallgren 2010-04-22 17:54:18 EDT Buckminster uses the team CVS provider which in turn uses extssh which in turn relies on the ssh configuration provided by the platform. This means that if you have configured a key pair (using standard ssh semantics) so that you can ssh to the CVS machine without getting prompted for a password, then Buckminster (and Eclipse IDE) will work too.  I might miss something here, but I don't think this is in Buckminsters domain.  [reply] Comment 2 Michal Ruzicka 2010-05-26 21:04:13 EDT (In reply to comment #1) > Buckminster uses the team CVS provider which in turn uses extssh which in turn > relies on the ssh configuration provided by the platform. Particularly the extssh method is not easily configurable in Buckminster, in fact the only options to configure it are: - to use workspace template - to use Buckminster's  exportprefs/importprefs commands neither of which is very flexible. It turns out to be more flexible to use the ext connection method as its default settings work just fine in server environment - it uses the external ssh command by default - and thus the needed configuration can be done at ssh level.  > This means that if > you have configured a key pair (using standard ssh semantics) so that you can > ssh to the CVS machine without getting prompted for a password, then > Buckminster (and Eclipse IDE) will work too. Yes, this works, but unfortunately this is not very suitable for the Hudson environment where different jobs need to use different credentials (private keys) to access the repositories they need, yet all of the jobs run under the same Hudson user account. It would be possible to add all of the required keys to the ssh configuration in Hudson's home directory but this is not straightforward since only Hudson user can read/write the respective files, moreover managing the private keys separately from the Hudson jobs that make use of them would inevitably lead to stale/obsolete private key files.  > > I might miss something here, but I don't think this is in Buckminsters domain. Given the reasons above (no flexible way to configure extssh method in Buckminster and the ext method not being suitable for extensive use in the Hudson environment), there is a valid need for Buckminster to provide a flexible way of configuring ssh parameters (which are used by the extssh method).  [reply] Comment 3 Michal Ruzicka 2010-05-26 21:26:38 EDT added two new preferences to Buckminster:  *sshPrivateKeys* a comma separated list of files each containing a private key to use when attempting SSH public key authentication (this preference corresponds to the "Private Keys" field found on the "General" tab of the "General / Network Connections / SSH2" preference page)  *ssh2Home* SSH implementation home directory - this directory is searched for the known_hosts file (this preference corresponds to the "SSH2 Home" field found on the "General" tab of the "General / Network Connections / SSH2" preference page)  committed in revision: 11445  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Need a way to publish a JRE IU into a p2 repository
description: Need a way to publish a JRE IU into a p2 repository [reply] Description Michal Ruzicka 2010-04-23 09:57:02 EDT I have the following problem: I create a p2 repository as a primary result of my Buckminster based build, then I want to package certain components from this repository as the zip files used for distribution in the old days. Since the desired content of the zip files corresponds to dependencies of certain features that are part of the built repo, it is just natural to use the p2.director to install the required artifacts into an arbitrary location where they can be conveniently zipped.  But the p2.director refuses to install the required artifacts without their dependencies - this can be to large extent overcome by passing the target platform used during the build as one of the repository locations to be consulted by the p2.director. This naturally provides all the required dependencies (otherwise the build could not succeed) except one: JRE IU  Publishing a JRE IU into any of the repositories involved would solve the problem, that is why I need a way to do so.  [reply] Comment 1 Michal Ruzicka 2010-04-26 02:29:56 EDT Implemented as both: - actor: buckminster.JREPublisher - ant task: buckminster.publishJRE  Either of those needs to be told which p2 repository to publish the JRE to. This is done using metadata.repository actor property in case of the Actor, or using repository/metadataRepository attributes of the ant task.  It is also possible to specify which JRE Environment IU to publish, it is done using jre.environment.name actor property, repsectively jreEnvironment ant task attribute (if not specified a default JRE IU is published).  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: [memory] GDB-DSF memory retrieval hangs when creating memory block at function symbol
description: [memory] GDB-DSF memory retrieval hangs when creating memory block at function symbol [reply] Description Alain Lee 2010-05-04 10:39:02 EDT When an invalid symbol or address is entered to Go To Address, nothing happens. I expect an error message box.  [reply] Comment 1 Teodor Madan 2010-05-10 06:40:24 EDT Is it reproducible with CDI/DSF gdb? Note, debugger backend should throw an error for calls to IMemoryBlockRetrievalExtension.getExtendedMemoryBlock(String, Object)  With CDT 7.0. I do receive an error pop-up when entering an invalid expression.  [reply] Comment 2 Alain Lee 2010-05-10 15:08:18 EDT (In reply to comment #1) > Is it reproducible with CDI/DSF gdb? Note, debugger backend should throw an > error for calls to > IMemoryBlockRetrievalExtension.getExtendedMemoryBlock(String, Object) > With CDT 7.0. I do receive an error pop-up when entering an invalid expression.  I investigated this problem further and found and this is what happened. We used our own expression service to evaluate the expression. It knew that the symbol was not defined but did not notify the request monitor that the request failed. Hence, the DataRequestMonitor in DsfMemoryBlockRetrieval.resolveMemoryAddress() handles handleSuccess(). "String value = data.getFormattedValue().substring(2);" actually contains an error message string. Therefore, "drm.setData(new BigInteger(value, 16));" threw an exception and the request was hung forever. We definitely should fix the bug in our expression service. As a safeguard, I think handleSuccess()should also catch exceptions.  [reply] Comment 3 Teodor Madan 2010-05-12 09:11:45 EDT I managed to reproduce this too. On head, the eclipse is hanging when trying to evaluate "main".  To reproduce: - Use GDB (DSF) launcher on Windows MinGW with gdb 6.8. - Open Memory Browser and enter symbol "main" - UI is locked.  The details on the symbol "main" from expression view -  Name : main Details:{int (void)} 0x401130 <main> Default:{int (void)} 0x401130 <main> Decimal:<error reading variable> Hex:<error reading variable> Binary:<error reading variable> Octal:<error reading variable>  [reply] Comment 4 Teodor Madan 2010-05-12 09:20:43 EDT Created attachment 168135 [details] Bulletproof handleSuccess() from DsfMemoryBlockRetrieval.resolveMemoryAddress()  The patch is just bullet proofing the handleSuccess from  DsfMemoryBlockRetrieval.resolveMemoryAddress().  This does not rule-out the fix for GDB-MI expression evaluation service that should fail.  [reply] Comment 5 Alain Lee 2010-06-04 10:12:56 EDT (In reply to comment #4) > Created an attachment (id=168135) [details] > Bulletproof handleSuccess() from DsfMemoryBlockRetrieval.resolveMemoryAddress() > The patch is just bullet proofing the handleSuccess from > DsfMemoryBlockRetrieval.resolveMemoryAddress(). > This does not rule-out the fix for GDB-MI expression evaluation service that > should fail.  Can anyone commit this patch to HEAD?  [reply] Comment 6 Teodor Madan 2010-06-07 11:44:21 EDT Marc, could you please review? Taking in account that this bug will hang eclipse UI could we target the fix for CDT 7.0 final?  [reply] Comment 7 Doug Schaefer 2010-06-07 11:54:10 EDT Holding off respin until you guys decide.  [reply] Comment 8 Pawel Piech 2010-06-07 14:57:07 EDT I committed a somewhat more narrow fix.  I'll file a separate bug for DSF-GDB to return a proper error status when expression valuation fails.... though we should hold off on fixing that one as it may uncover issues elsewhere.  [reply] Comment 9 CDT Genie 2010-06-07 15:23:09 EDT *** cdt cvs genie on behalf of ppiech *** Bug 311564 - [memory] GDB-DSF memory retrieval hangs when creating memory block at function symbol  [*] DsfMemoryBlockRetrieval.java 1.5 http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.cdt/dsf/org.eclipse.cdt.dsf/src/org/eclipse/cdt/dsf/debug/model/DsfMemoryBlockRetrieval.java?root=Tools_Project&r1=1.4&r2=1.5  [reply] Comment 10 Teodor Madan 2010-06-08 02:36:08 EDT Mark issue as resolved fixed  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Allow committers to rename jobs they can modify
description: Allow committers to rename jobs they can modify [reply] Description Steve Powell 2010-05-06 11:26:14 EDT Presently although I can modify Hudson jobs (for which I have admin/modify permissions) I cannot rename them. I discover this part-way through the rename process on the Hudson GUI.  This is apparently because I am not granted create permission for a job, and rename is (probably) implemented as a create(clone) followed by a delete, each of which is checked for permissions.  Please implement rename as a separately controlled action with its own independent permissions control.  [reply] Comment 1 Nick Boldt 2010-05-11 10:10:15 EDT For which job do you need this control? Perhaps the existing "Delete" access will allow you to do a rename?  [reply] Comment 2 Steve Powell 2010-05-12 12:06:40 EDT (In reply to comment #1) > For which job do you need this control? Perhaps the existing "Delete" access > will allow you to do a rename?  It was virgo.web-server.snapshot (or something) and it was named virg.web-server.snapshot (or something).  The initial set-up doesn't give me delete permission (and I understand why not) although I can grant myself delete.  but the message I got out when I tried to rename it was that I didn't have CREATE permission (which indeed I do not, and cannot obtain).  The job I was attempting to rename has been renamed by admin. I shouldn't need DELETE permission to rename; thus the enhancement request.  [reply] Comment 3 Eclipse Webmaster 2012-03-30 10:29:12 EDT Moving to the Hudson project.  As far as I can tell you are correct the permissions simply aren't granular enough to grant delete and create permissions on a 'per job' basis.  -M.  [reply] Comment 4 Winston Prakash 2013-07-02 15:41:02 EDT We have implemented Team Concept in Hudson.  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=406601  This issue can be solved through this multi-tenancy or using Role Strategy plugin (http://wiki.hudson-ci.org/display/HUDSON/Role+Strategy+Plugin)  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

summary: Disassembly view throws NPE when debugging with  CDI
description: Disassembly view throws NPE when debugging with  CDI [reply] Description Andy Jin 2010-06-17 13:45:33 EDT Build Identifier: I20100608-0911  When debugging a program with a large share library linked over a remote target, the program takes some time to be load the share library. During this loading period if I have the Disassembly view opened it will throw NPE with below trace:  java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.cdt.debug.internal.ui.disassembly.dsf.DisassemblyBackendCdi.setDebugContext(DisassemblyBackendCdi.java:132) at org.eclipse.cdt.dsf.debug.internal.ui.disassembly.DisassemblyPart.updateDebugContext(DisassemblyPart.java:1798) at org.eclipse.cdt.dsf.debug.internal.ui.disassembly.DisassemblyView $1.selectionChanged(DisassemblyView.java:66) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.AbstractPartSelectionTracker $1.run(AbstractPartSelectionTracker.java:119) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:42) at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:888) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.AbstractPartSelectionTracker.fireSelection(AbstractPartSelectionTracker.java:117) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PagePartSelectionTracker $1.selectionChanged(PagePartSelectionTracker.java:49) ......................................  Looking at org.eclipse.cdt.debug.internal.ui.disassembly.dsf.DisassemblyBackendCdi.setDebugContext(DisassemblyBackendCdi.java:132), it does a "fTargetContext.getTopStackFrame()". This function can return Null if the thread is not in suspended mode thus the stack frame is an empty list.  In our case the program is in the process of loading the share library so its thread is not suspended.  It's pretty re-producible with CDI. I haven't seen this problem with DSF.  Reproducible: Sometimes  Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a program linking with a large shared library 2. Debug this program with CDI remote debug 3. Make sure the disassembly view is opened before you run the debug.  [reply] Comment 1 John Cortell 2010-06-17 17:20:42 EDT Created attachment 172162 [details] Fix  Andy, please try this patch with your reproducible scenario. It occurred to me that the code can't really rely on the thread being suspended. All we know is that at some point in time, we had a suspended thread and one of its frames was set as the active debug context. The thread may have since been resumed, died, whatever. We can use whatever static information we can get from the frame context, but we can't assume anything else. We simply have to be more guarded in that logic.  [reply] Comment 2 Teodor Madan 2010-06-18 04:05:14 EDT Created attachment 172194 [details] Fix for NPE when getting frame address  Another NPE caused by thread going into run mode is when getting frame address.  [reply] Comment 3 John Cortell 2010-06-18 11:37:40 EDT Toni, please review these patches. I've committed my patch to HEAD and cdt_7_0. Teo, I'll leave the commit if your patch to you since you now have commit rights! :-) I reviewed it and it looks good to me.  [reply] Comment 4 CDT Genie 2010-06-18 12:23:04 EDT *** cdt cvs genie on behalf of jcortell *** Bug 317226: Disassembly view throws NPE when debugging with CDI  [*] DisassemblyBackendCdi.java 1.11 http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.cdt/all/org.eclipse.cdt.debug.ui/src/org/eclipse/cdt/debug/internal/ui/disassembly/dsf/DisassemblyBackendCdi.java?root=Tools_Project&r1=1.10&r2=1.11  [*] DisassemblyBackendCdi.java 1.10.2.1 http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.cdt/all/org.eclipse.cdt.debug.ui/src/org/eclipse/cdt/debug/internal/ui/disassembly/dsf/DisassemblyBackendCdi.java?root=Tools_Project&r1=1.10&r2=1.10.2.1  [reply] Comment 5 CDT Genie 2010-06-18 12:38:20 EDT *** cdt cvs genie on behalf of tmadan *** Bug 317226: Disassembly view throws NPE when debugging with CDI. Fix also NPE when getting frame address  [*] CDIDisassemblyRetrieval.java 1.4 http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.cdt/all/org.eclipse.cdt.debug.ui/src/org/eclipse/cdt/debug/internal/ui/disassembly/dsf/CDIDisassemblyRetrieval.java?root=Tools_Project&r1=1.3&r2=1.4  [reply] Comment 6 Teodor Madan 2010-06-19 03:47:58 EDT commited my patch to HEAD and cdt_7_0. And marked as rezolved  [reply] Comment 7 CDT Genie 2010-06-19 04:23:03 EDT *** cdt cvs genie on behalf of tmadan *** Bug 317226: Disassembly view throws NPE when debugging with CDI. Fix also NPE when getting frame address  [*] CDIDisassemblyRetrieval.java 1.3.2.1 http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.cdt/all/org.eclipse.cdt.debug.ui/src/org/eclipse/cdt/debug/internal/ui/disassembly/dsf/CDIDisassemblyRetrieval.java?root=Tools_Project&r1=1.3&r2=1.3.2.1  [reply] Comment 8 James Blackburn 2010-06-24 12:31:11 EDT *** Bug 314268 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***  [reply] Comment 9 Andy Jin 2010-07-08 14:43:47 EDT - Sorry for the delay, John. description: PHPDoc starting with /*** are highlighted like Multi line comments [reply] Description Teodor Kirkov 2010-06-18 08:37:02 EDT Build Identifier: 2.2.0.v20100616  If have multi line comment entered at PDT Editor at some cases entered parameters there are read like a PHPDoc comment  Reproducible: Always  Steps to Reproduce: 1.Have the following code at PDT <?php /*** * Main description * @param test * @author test */ function test (){ } $test = te| //invoke content assist at | sign  2. At CA look at suggested for test() tooltip 3. Hover over test() definition and look again tooltip  Expected result: This is not a PHPDoc comment so at tool tips must have only function name without any additional information - it must be the same like use /* for comment start  Actual result: At tool tips have additional information about functions comment - can see whole information like a PHPDoc, but this is not a PHPDoc - look attached  [reply] Comment 1 Teodor Kirkov 2010-06-18 08:37:39 EDT Created attachment 172210 [details] Wrong tooltip suggestion  [reply] Comment 2 Jacek Pospychala 2010-06-20 16:08:24 EDT It's nice catch, however PHPDocumentor manual doesn't say that such comments are not phpdoc blocks. They say that "every DocBlock comment is a C-style comment with two leading asterisks (*)". So imho we neither should be making any assumptions or guesses about user intentions to not break compatibility with PHPDocumentor. description: [Memory Browser]Switching between two cpus does not affect edit box where address is entered [reply] Description Alain Lee 2010-07-07 16:56:45 EDT You have two different processors while debugging and you enter two different addresses. When switching debug context, the edit box shows last entered value. It would be good if it were possible to keep that value in synch with rendering.  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Start a debug session for configuration with more than one cpu. 2. Open memory view with debug context set to CPU A and enter an address in Memory Browser. 3. Change debug context to CPU B and enter a new address in Memory Browser. 4. Switching between CPU A and CPU B changes the rendering correctly and tab title is also showing correct address, but edit box where address was originally entered does not change.  It would be good if address edit box could be kept in synch as well. Since this is where I entered my address, I tend to look there for address information.  [reply] Comment 1 Teodor Madan 2010-07-16 10:45:22 EDT Created attachment 174501 [details] fix  Track the last good expression in the tab folder data.  question though, wouldn't be better for updating expression per active tab as well?  i.e. 1. Open Memory Browser view 2. GoTo expression "symbol1" 3. Create new tab with expression "symbol2" 4. Each time user changes active tab then expression field would be updating according to the expression used to create/reposition the rendering from the active tab folder. summary: Query being run twice for sybase jConnect
description: Query being run twice for sybase jConnect [reply] Description john mcteague 2010-07-28 04:12:38 EDT Build Identifier: 20090920-1017  Running reports using legacy stored procs that self audit shows that the query(s) are being executed twice for each report.  A little digging shows that jConnect is listed under policy type 2 in oda-jdbc.jar/config.xml which means the query is first executed with a max rows of 1, metadata obtained and then executed again with the correct max rows value to get the full resultset.  I modified config.xml to put jConnect in policy type 1 which means the query is executed, result sets cached, metadata obtained and then the result set used later.  I have (thus far) not seen any issue with this.  I am looking to find out why jConnect is set to policy type 2 in the first place and whether moving to 1 will have any consequences. If there are none, can it be moved to policy 1 permanently?  Reproducible: Always  [reply] Comment 1 john mcteague 2010-07-28 04:14:17 EDT Created attachment 175376 [details] The modified config.xml  [reply] Comment 2 john mcteague 2010-07-28 04:16:39 EDT I am using jConnect3 v6.0.5 and jConnect2 v5.5 drivers to test this. Both exhibit the same behaviour.  [reply] Comment 3 john mcteague 2010-07-28 04:19:53 EDT Created attachment 175377 [details] Sample report.  Attached sample report. Inserts into a table called AUDIT_LOG and then queries sysobjects.  [reply] Comment 4 Zhang Lei 2011-04-28 03:35:47 EDT move jConnect to policy category 1. fix this issue.  [reply] Comment 5 Xiaoying Gu 2011-04-28 03:45:40 EDT Verified in daily build 3.7.0.20110427  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments

Reproducible: Always  Steps to Reproduce: 1. Checkout org.eclipse.gmf.examples.mindmap.rcp.diagram, ...mindmap.edit and ...mindmap from CVS. 2. Open an example mindmap editor, create a topic, and click "Dependency" on the palette 4. I am on Windows Vista, you are using Windows 7, did you already tried reproduce it on Vista?  Ho wdo you configure to use TreeRouter? To activate it, I need to modify RelationshipEditPart, Relationship2EditPart.  The NPE pop up a window or is it only in the log that you have the error?  Thanks for report Regards, Aurelien  [reply] Comment 2 Yu Li 2011-03-03 10:33:06 EST (In reply to comment #1) > Hi, > > I can't reproduce your issue. > > Which version of GMF are you using? > > I am on Windows Vista, you are using Windows 7, did you already tried reproduce > it on Vista? > > Ho wdo you configure to use TreeRouter? To activate it, I need to modify > RelationshipEditPart, Relationship2EditPart. > > The NPE pop up a window or is it only in the log that you have the error? > > Thanks for report > Regards, > Aurelien  Hi,  According to my test a short while ago, the NullPointerException remains reproducible.  I'm using GMF SDK 2.3.0.v20100508 and Windows 7, but haven't tried on Vista.  To configure to use TreeRouter, you need only to modify  org.eclipse.gmf.examples.mindmap.rcp.diagram.preferences.DiagramPreferenceInitializer.java  as described in step 2.  The error message will appear on the console of the eclipse workbench, from which the mindmap application is started.  Regards, Yu  [reply] Comment 3 Johannes Michler 2011-04-21 09:44:45 EDT I can reproduce this with windows 7 and the Helios 3.6.2 GMF-Builds ().  Please note: The error doesn't occur on every creation of a connection but is somewhat random. But when trying to create 10 connections, be assured at least once there will be the mentioned null-pointer-exception.  I tried to track this down by adding a breakpoint to the first line of the method  org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.draw2d.ui.internal.routers.TreeRouter.getTargetAnchorRelativeBounds(Connection)  with the following condition: conn.getTargetAnchor().getOwner()==null  (This is where Yu Li has his NPE in line 130 of the TreeRouter.java).  I think the problem is caused in TreeRouter.invalidate-Method:  public void invalidate(Connection conn) { if (conn.getSourceAnchor() == null || conn.getSourceAnchor().getOwner() == null || conn.getTargetAnchor() == null || conn.getTargetAnchor().getOwner() == null) return;  ListIterator li = connectionList.listIterator(); while (li.hasNext()) { Connection connNext = (Connection)li.next();  if (!trunkVertexEqual(connNext, conn)) { updateConstraint(connNext); } } }   There is a check if conn.getTargetAnchor().getOwner() is null. But this is done on the conn-Object, whereas some lines further-down updateConstraint is called with some Connection from the connectionList.  When having the mentioned NPE, the situation while being in the invalidate-Method is as follows:  conn.getSourceAnchor() and conn.getTargetAnchor() are both the same SlideableAnchor pointing to a DefaultSizeNodeFigure. Therefore in the first line of invalidate everything is fine  The connectionList consists of one single PolyLineConnection. This connNext-Object has the same SlideableAnchor as its source as the conn-Object. But the target of the connNext-Object points to an XYAnchor. And calling the getOwner() method of an XYAnchor returns null. This is what leads to the NPE later on in the getTargetAnchorRelativeBounds-Method.   My proposed fix for this is to check the owner of the sourceAnchor and targetAnchor before calling udpateConstraint on connNext. I've attached a patch that fixes the problem on the mindmap-sample.  Yu Li: Could you please verify?  I'd propse to bring this into 3.7, since the bug is really annoying when using the tree-router...  Best regards  Johannes Michler  Horus software GmbH Incorporating the Power of Knowledge from Business Communities: http://www.horus.biz  [reply] Comment 4 Johannes Michler 2011-04-21 09:46:00 EDT Created attachment 193820 [details] propsed patch for gmf 1.4.2_v20101217-0030  fix according to my comment. Please verify if this fixes the bug and if it has any negative side-effects...  [reply] Comment 5 Yu Li 2011-04-21 11:53:49 EDT Thanks, Johannes, the patch works according to my test. It would be fine if this patch can be incorporated into the new GMF version...  [reply] Comment 6 Aurelien Pupier 2011-04-21 12:23:29 EDT (In reply to comment #5) > Thanks, Johannes, the patch works according to my test. It would be fine if > this patch can be incorporated into the new GMF version...  Thanks for the patch Johannes  I will try to take a look at this next week  [reply] Comment 7 Aurelien Pupier 2011-04-23 15:12:09 EDT Created attachment 193960 [details] second version of patch  I attach another patch. You were checking if the targetAnchor on ConneExt is null and not different from null. Can you check that it is what you wanted to do?  Can you also provide a test case?  Regards,  [reply] Comment 8 Johannes Michler 2011-04-24 08:50:55 EDT Created attachment 193966 [details] fix:check for !=null instead of ==null on every parameter  Of cause I meant to execute the updateConstraint-Method only if source and target anchor and their owner are NOT null. So this was a typo, thank you for fixing it. But you just fixed one check, I've fixed the second too...  Yu Li provided a test-case, unfortunately I have no better or always reproducible way to test this :-(  Best regards Johannes Michler  [reply] Comment 9 Aurelien Pupier 2011-05-05 16:29:45 EDT patch applied  [reply] Comment 10 Anthony Hunter 2011-05-05 17:21:49 EDT Comment on attachment 193966 [details] fix:check for !=null instead of ==null on every parameter  Add iplog tag for Indigo since the patch came from a non committer. summary: ActionBarContributor cleanup
description: ActionBarContributor cleanup [reply] Description Michael Wenz 2010-08-18 10:00:59 EDT The coding in the above class needs some cleanup. Especially all the toolbar entries should also appear in main menu.  [reply] Comment 1 Michael Wenz 2011-02-07 11:14:59 EST Thinks to check: 1. Put only the most commonly used commands on the view toolbar. Any command on a toolbar must also appear in a menu, either the window menu, context menu or the view menu. http://wiki.eclipse.org/User_Interface_Guidelines#Toolbars_2 2. If a view or editor has support for Cut, Copy, Paste, or any of the global commands, these commands must be executable from the same commands in the window menu bar and toolbar. http://wiki.eclipse.org/User_Interface_Guidelines#Menus and http://wiki.eclipse.org/User_Interface_Guidelines#Integration_with_the_Window_Menu_Bar_and_Toolbar  [reply] Comment 2 Juergen Pasch 2011-04-01 12:33:51 EDT The above text and links are related to views and not to editors in the UI guidelines.  Therefore, these issues are clarified here again.  A VIEW consists of a title area, a (view specific) toolbar, a (view specific) pulldown menu, and an embedded control, which comprises a context menu. The context menu is used for selection oriented commands ( 7.13), while the pulldown menu shall offer presentation commands (7.10). The (view specific) toolbar is used to expose the most commonly used commands in a view (7.12). Any command on this view toolbar must also appear either in the context menu or the pull down menu. Examples for 7.12 are hard to find, because integration with the Window Menu Bar and Toolbar is similiar: if a view has support for Cut, Copy, Paste, or any of the global commands, these commands must be executable from the same commands in the window menu bar and toolbar (7.19).  The guidelines for EDITORS are simpler, they do not have specific toolbars and pull down menus and no presentation commands.  1. All of the commands, except for the obvious commands, available in the editor should be added to the window menu bar (6.7).  2. If an editor has support for Cut, Copy, Paste, or any of the global commands, these commands must be executable from the same commands in the window menu bar and toolbar (6.9).  3. An editor may contribute commands directly to the window toolbar. The toolbar is used to expose the most commonly used commands in an editor. Any command which appears in the toolbar must also appear in the menu, but there is no need to duplicate every command in the menu within the toolbar (6.10).  4. Fill the context menu with selection oriented commands (6.11). All commands for the view (or editor) should be made available on the main menubar, and only frequently used commands are on the context menu.  CHECK if Graphiti follows the rules 1 - 4. When checking 1, take notice of guideline 6.8.  For 1-4 consider the selection state of the command (6.13).  For 4 take account of 6.12 - 6.15  [reply] Comment 3 Juergen Pasch 2011-04-13 07:43:28 EDT Wrong behaviour of selection states in actions are corrected.  The main menu bar is extended with: File-> Export Diagram..; Edit-> Remove, Update, Align-> <all alignment commands>.  Short cuts needed adjustments and accelerators for Export Diagram, Remove and Update are implemented.  [reply] Comment 4 Michael Wenz 2011-05-27 09:21:29 EDT Part of 0.8.0  [reply] Comment 5 Michael Wenz 2011-06-24 09:12:07 EDT Part of Graphiti Indigo 0.8.0  Add Comment  Collapse All Comments Expand All Comments
